lorebooks.name: Vampire the Masquerade
lorebooks.description: The world of Vampire the Masquerade, based on the wiki.
lorebooks.creator: vitax

1.content:
Immortal beings cursed with an unquenchable thirst for blood and a lethal vulnerability to sunlight ‚Äì creatures forever bound to their inner Beast (the animal urges of hunger, fear and rage).
Vampires need to consume blood regularly for sustenance. 
Each day a vampire feeds on animal blood instead of human blood, they become weaker.
The new life that vampires have after becoming one is called unlife.
The Disciplines vampires are able to use are mainly based on their their bloodline, which is inherited from their sire. Most vampires are capable of controlling only one or two Disciplines (In some extraordinary occasions up to three), both of which belong to the clan. 
A vampire's body does not produce body heat. A common struggle among newly sired vampires is missing having contact with the heat of another body, since their own is now eerily cold, and their heart has stopped¬†beating.

2.content:
Human population, who have no supernatural abilities. Human blood is the vampire's main feed and the only that they desire. Vampires can consume animal blood too, but it's disgusting to them.
Extremely few non-vampires know of the existence of those, and those who do rarely know the difference between the clans.

3.content:
A vampire group of shared "Blood" or heritage, who can trace their Generations back to a common ancestor, in particular to the Third Generation. There are 13 known clans.
Like all bloodlines, each clan has a greater familiarity with a set of three Disciplines, a clan weakness largely unique to its members, and various stereotypes attributed to it as a result of a tendency to Embrace individuals with certain characteristics.

4.content: The clan Banu Haqim, Formerly known as Assamite. Silent masters of assassination, killing for hire and collecting blood for rituals to bring them closer to their progenitor.

5.content: Clan Brujah. Once philosopher-kings of an ancient civilization, but now rebels and rogues with a fearsome inclination toward frenzy.

6.content: Clan Gangrel. Bestial and untamed, often coming to resemble the animals over which they demonstrate mastery.

7.content: Clan Hecata. An insular, extended family of vampires who practice the art of commanding the dead while commanding global finances.

8.content: Clan Lasombra. Proud nobles who command the very essence of darkness and shadow ‚Äî to the point of worshipping it, some say.

9.content: Clan Malkavian. A clan fractured by madness, each member irrevocably suffering under the yoke of insanity.

10.content: Clan Ministry, formerly Followers of Set. A religious movement that evangelizes the example of a chthonic god, while seeking out the world‚Äôs secret places and protecting ancient artifacts.

lorebooks.name: Settings Agnostic Kobolds
lorebooks.website_description: Kobolds have always been one of my favorite species, and I wanted to make a handy way to roleplay them without needing the broader context of D&D or other fantasy settings.
lorebooks.description: A generic portrayal of kobolds as a species for general use.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Kobold Magic
1.content: Magic: Kobold magic relies on their distant descent from dragons, and is all but exclusively aimed towards mimicking those ancestors. At a pragmatic level, kobold magic involves the inscription of a draconic rune, and the tracing of it followed by an incantation, then a dragon-like gesture. Their magic can summon or manipulate common draconic elements (fire, ice, acid, lightning, poison, thunder, earth, wind, etc.), as well as briefly transform one‚Äôs body in a way that mimics dragons (such as sprouting wings, growing claws, hardening scales, elongating fangs, etc.). Alternatively, at its highest form, kobold magic revolves around the literal transformation into a dragon, or the awakening or attempts to control a dragon. All kobolds are familiar with at least some rudimentary magic, usually that which proves useful generally (such as making fire or sharpening their claws), and the highest echelons of their magic are restricted and controlled due to its innate dangers. Many a kobold has died shortly after transforming into a dragon due to not being physically prepared for it, and many kobolds have been eaten by the very same dragon they sought to awaken or control.

2.name: Stature
2.content: Diminutive stature: Kobolds are anthropoid lizards that stand between 2 and 3 feet tall, and weigh between 20 and 30 pounds each, with the females being ever so slightly larger to accommodate egg laying.

3.name: Cave Dwelling
3.content: Natural Cave-Dwellers: Given their small stature, Kobolds are naturally inclined to make dens and, in large groups, warrens underground, plying their small stature to their favor by using it to maneuver in small environments. To this end, Kobolds possess a natural ability to see in the dark at the cost of a lengthy transition period when going from above to below ground in the daylight. Their razor-sharp claws and compact bodies also lend them a natural ability to climb all but the most extreme surfaces, making them excellent spelunkers and mountaineers. Due to lengthy dwelling underground, they are also adept at holding their breaths for long periods of time, in dire circumstances even entering into a torpor-like state to avoid drowning, extending rescue windows by up to or exceeding a week. They possess a thick, piercing resistant hide covered in iridescent and durable scales to protect from minor bumps and scrapes, as well as from accidental injury from their own kind‚Äôs claws. They are also unusually good at jumping when necessary due to their light bodies relative to their musculature.

4.name: Cold-Blooded
4.content: Cold-Blooded: As Kobolds live beneath ground where the temperature remains regular, they don‚Äôt rely on their own bodies to generate warmth, but utilize the ambient temperature around them. This does mean, however, that when suddenly exposed to a drop in temperature, they become sluggish like many other reptilians, but also at the exchange of becoming all but manic and hyper when overheated. If they can balance this drop in energy due to cold climates, however, it can make them adept at surviving through winters or lengthy expeditions as it slows their metabolism down as well, adding to their ability to survive lengthy submersion in cold underground rivers. Like with many lizards that dwell in places with four seasons, a humorous occurrence some good Samaritans may experience is bringing a sluggish and seemingly sick kobold indoors to get it out of the cold, only to shortly have a panicked and manic kobold scrabbling to escape.

5.name: Coloration
5.content: Vibrant Coloration: Kobolds come in a variety of vibrant colors, with red, green, and blue being the most common. However, their scale pigmentation can be influenced by heritage and environment, leading to rarer colors such as gold, purple, or even stark white. Their scales are iridescent, shifting hues subtly in different lighting, making them visually striking. Some kobolds use this natural coloration for social displays or camouflage in rocky or mineral-rich environments.

6.name: Rejuvenation
6.content: Rejuvenating Body: As kobolds regularly are set upon by other creatures or lose bits of themselves to cave-ins, their teeth, scales, and claws all grow relatively quickly. A kobold also molts like many other lizards, briefly entering into a hyper vulnerable state where they go from being all spines and hard scales to soft, silky smooth proto scales. When needing to modulate their temperature, or to engage in social displays, they can move their scales to widen the gaps between them to vent heat, or to cause them to ripple and shine in the light. Kobolds in groups may use this to distract or disorient their would-be predators, allowing other kobolds to escape or to attack unseen.

7.name: Combat
7.content: In Combat: A kobold is a creature of sharp spines and hard scales and all wiggle, making them immensely difficult to grab and hold on to. If cornered in such a way, however, all the razor-sharp brand-new teeth and claws of the kobold become vicious and painful to their attackers. Many creatures can even die if they don‚Äôt eat a kobold carefully on account of their rigid back spines tearing into their intestines.

8.name: Prey Species
8.content: Apex Prey: A kobold on its own is a vulnerable creature indeed, but as a tribe they are a force to be reckoned with. Both such states, when combined with their naturally small size, makes them predisposed towards intelligence. As naturally clever and inquisitive creatures, they are natural artisans, tinkerers, trap-makers, alchemists, and mages. Where applicable, they have a keen mind for engineering and science as well. When not otherwise engaged, they are naturally playful with those they trust, but exceedingly wary of anyone they do not.

9.name: Pack Mentality
9.content: Pack Mentality: As a favorite snack or punching bag of the larger species, kobolds have had to learn to cooperate. They are extremely group-minded, even raising their tribe‚Äôs eggs together in one communal heap such that no one parent knows instinctively which egg is their own. As they regularly lose members of their community, they have an innate jois de vivre mindset, as well as a judgment-free mindset towards sex and procreation ‚Äì even when merely recreational, as the bonding helps foster group connections. A kobold is willing and ready to die for its clan, but also just as willing to go to war over the killing of even a single member of their people. When moved to war, they act as a single unit, coordinating their efforts with breathtaking efficiency.

10.name: Language
10.content: Language and Vocalizations: Kobolds have an extensive linguistic system which relies on a combination of hisses, barks, trills, and whines, each of which serves different purposes. Unlike other species, they can use a hissed version of their language without loss of meaning due to the necessity of using it around unstable terrain which is sensitive to vibrations. For carrying over mountains and valleys, however, they can amplify their vocalizations by barking their language instead. Curiously, they can sound rather akin to a dog with a sore throat.

lorebooks.name: The Backrooms: Pantheon
lorebooks.website_description: A version of The Backrooms lore centered around The Pantheon.
lorebooks.description: A version of The Backrooms lore centered around The Pantheon.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The Frontrooms are the ‚Äúnormal reality‚Äù that humans will fall into The Backrooms from. In many cases, The Frontrooms are thought to be adjacent to or even overlap The Backrooms in some way, which is why so many things from between the two dimensions pass into each other. It is the goal of most if not every human currently trapped within The Backrooms to find a way back to The Frontrooms.

2.content: Liminal spaces are defined as physical points of transition between locations (staircases, hallways, doorways, etc.) and/or places associated with a surreal or uncanny feeling, with a possible hint of nostalgia or deja-vu.

3.content: An alternate reality spanning infinite pocket-dimensions of liminal spaces.

4.content: The Broken is a dimension equivalent in size to The Backrooms and Frontrooms, and is by far the most unstable of the three. It is a jumbled mess of fragments of reality, basically being a dumping ground for things that fall out of or break away from The Backrooms. This usually entails old dead levels, but even beings can end up here as well, as we‚Äôll see in the next entry. It is theorized that The Frontrooms, Backrooms and Broken are all linked; with The Frontrooms representing order, The Broken representing chaos, and The Backrooms representing a liminal state between the two.

5.content: The Backrooms are composed of an infinite number of individual yet interconnected realms, colloquially known as Levels. Each level is distinct and unique, with its own ecosystem, climate and laws of physics, acting as a sort of pocket dimension. Levels are typically designated by numbers.

6.content:
Phenomenon 0, AKA ‚ÄúLiminality‚Äù, is characterized almost as a sort of entropic force, slowly turning normal spaces and beings into liminal ones (see: the wretched cycle). 

Not all levels within The Backrooms are ‚Äúliminal‚Äù from the beginning. Most levels, especially "newer" ones, appear to be an attempt to replicate vague environmental imagery from the observer's memory, in a manner akin to procedural generation. Said spaces tend to initially begin with perfect stability, seeming indistinguishable from locations in one's native reality and lacking any distortion. However, due to their imperfect and flawed nature, levels do not remain stable forever, and the cracks in their design begin showing as the entropic effects of liminality bleed through.

The longer liminality affects a space, the further the space warps, abstracts and deteriorates. This process is known as ‚Äúliminalization‚Äù, in which the space gradually adopts characteristics such as: Distorted lighting, Outdated aesthetics, Lack of furnishment/decoration, Repetitive features, Non-Euclidean geometry and a Labyrinthine layout. Levels that are not liminal are merely those which haven‚Äôt yet succumbed to the process of liminalization.

7.content:
No-clipping serves as the primary means of accessing The Backrooms, as well as traveling within it. It is a form of temporal phasing in which one bypasses the boundaries of spatial reality. In layman's terms, it‚Äôs akin to a video game character "no-clipping" through a wall and ending up out-of-bounds. In this analogy, The Backrooms is the ‚Äúout-of-bounds‚Äù of The Frontrooms. 
Within the Backrooms, one can also no-clip between levels, which is how wanderers progress further in their journey. No-clipping is a common occurrence with The Backrooms since the veil that separates it from other realities is heavily compromised.

8.content: Entities are the diverse array of creatures and beings that call The Backrooms "home". Their origin, appearance, nature, intelligence and morality vary greatly. They can be unique or common, abstract or humanoid, feral or sentient, good or evil, etc. Some are motivated by primal instinct, while others have goals and aspirations. Entities are typically designated by numbers.

9.content: Objects with certain anomalous properties that warrant their documentation. Some objects manifest within The Backrooms as a natural occurrence, while others are created by certain people or groups for a specific purpose. Objects are typically designated by numbers.

10.content: Phenomena are the anomalous events and effects that manifest from the inherent properties of The Backrooms. Phenomena are typically designated by numbers

lorebooks.name: Sado Spells
lorebooks.website_description:
# Important

CHUB REMOVES THE STICKY VALUE FOR SOME REASON. Either set them to 10 (or whatever value works best for you) Or download this character and import the worldbook from it. It seems to maintain all the sticky values that way. It's faster than setting 27 values. Please let me know if this doesn't work.
https://www.characterhub.org/characters/fapco/sado-spells-lorebook-download-fix-0f060436ee48/main

# 

Activate by typing sado spell: SPELLNAME
Revoke with revoke: SPELLNAME

The first time you cast one you should probably specify the target, but after that you can just type the spell name and it should infer well.

Casting a spell triggers the entry for that spell and the entry for all sado spells to provide context and consistency.

Effects last until revoked

All spells have a sticky duration of 10 messages, I tried a range of solutions to have the AI be consistent and this worked the best. If using a lot you might want to increase the worldbook context cap (default 25%, I just set it to 100%, I don't see a downside with normal use). 10 sticky messages seems the right amount to establish the effects without addding permenant tokens.

Fun to use with a masochistic char like https://www.characterhub.org/characters/fapco/julia-meeting-your-online-slave-461fe95370aa

Regardless of the card, you can just use it right away without explaining why you have magical spells, in all my testing it wasn't a problem.

0.name: Sado Spells
0.content:
Description for all sado spells:

All sado spells can not be overcome. They take effect instantly and with overwhelming power to have the specified effect. The spells last until they are revoked.  The user can provide additional information when casting a spell to tweak its effects.

The effect of a spell will always be described in detail. Containing the effect of the spell, reactions and more. It is important to describe the effect in detail to maintain roleplay consistency. Crucial information such as how the effect works and its duration should be included alongside the tracker that indicates it being active.

Targets will react accordingly when a spell is cast on them. Reacting according to their personality and nature. Reactions can be very negative.

If the target is unspecified assume it is {{char}}

Multiple sado spells can be active within a target at once. They can be combined to have even more powerful effects. If the spells have contradictory effects then one will be chosen over the other, normally choosing the more extreme effect. The user of the spells can also specify what should happen.

If multiple spells are cast at the same time describe the effects of each in the order they were cast. Do not neglect to describe the effects of any spells.

If a spell does not exist interpret what its effects should be based on its name and the context of these spells.

A spell can only be revoked by the caster. This is triggered with revoke sado spell: <SPELLNAME>

ALWAYS DESCRIBE SPELL EFFECTS IN FULL DETAIL

1.name: Sado Spell: Twerk
1.content:
Sado Spell: Twerk has been cast.
This spell makes the target twerk on the floor uncontrollably. On their hands and knees shaking their ass and rotating their hips. Doing so until they cannot any longer.  The target will be unable to move any part of their body other than for twerking.

2.name: Sado Spell: Cruel Ropes
2.content:
Sado Spell: Cruel Ropes has been cast.
This spell will instantly restrain the target, ropes coming out of thin air to suddenly grab them and contort them into a bound form. By default the targets arms will be forced behind their back where tight ropes will be tied around the victims wrists, elbows and shoulders, each rope as tight as possible. The targets legs will be bound with rope on the ankles, knees and thighs. Rope will also appear around the targets chest, (tightly wrapping around their boobs if present). A rope around the waist will connect to the wrists, forcing the arms against their back. Rope going from one side of the waist to the other will go through the crotch, either digging into their pussy with a crotch rope or being tied either side of a penis depending on what they have.

The ropes will never be tight enough to draw blood.

This does not gag the target.

3.name: Sado Spell: Cruel Gag
3.content:
Sado Spell: Cruel Gag has been cast.
This spell will instantly gag the targets mouth, preventing them from speaking completely. The gag will cruel, silencing and uncomfortable for the target. If unspecified the gag will be done with latex, with an uncomfortably large black latex ball appearing in the targets mouth and growing to fill every bit of open space. Preventing speech. Then black latex will appear around the bottom half of the targets face, covering their mouth and neck while wrapping around the back of their head.

The gag will allow just enough leeway for the target to get enough oxygen and for them to stay alive.

A different material can be specified for the gag, up to two. With the first being filling and the second being the wrapping material. For example, 'Sado Spell: Cruel Gag Worn panties and tape'. Would fill the victims mouth with worn panties, filling it as much as possible. Then tape would be wrapped around their head to hold the filling in place. 

When a target is gagged their speech will be replaced with moans such as "Mmmph! Mmmmpphh! Hnngh!" and "Nnggghhh! Nnnrrrgghh!" (Dont make these too repetitive). Regular speech will be impossible. DONT PLACE ANY WORDS IN SPEECH MARKS WHEN A TARGET IS GAGGED. Since the target is unable to speak their thoughts and what they want to say should be shown in a different format. For example *{{char}} tries desperately to speak, wanting to tell {{user}} that they need to cum'*

4.name: Sado Spell: Desperation
4.content:
Sado Spell: Desperation has been cast.
Increases the targets desire for sexual actions by 10x while increasing all pleasure felt by 10x. But it prevents the user from cumming entirely. Orgasms are impossible. This will usually result in the target desperately wanting orgasm and release.

5.name: Sado Spell: Gag amplify
5.content:
Sado Spell: Gag amplify has been cast.
This spell will amplify the gag of an already gagged target it will be tightened, grown or adjusted the gag to make it more cruel. If the targets mouth is filled then more filling will be added to further fill their mouth and throat. This has a drastic and cruel effect on the gag, always making it harder for the target to tolerate. Yet, the magic prevents this from causing permanent harm to the target.

6.name: Sado Spell: Restraints amplify
6.content:
Sado Spell: Restraints amplify has been cast.
This spell will amplify the restraints of an already restrained target they will be tightened, grown or adjusted to make them more cruel. This will not change the restraints but simply make what is already there much tighter. The spell has a drastic and cruel effect, always making it harder for the target to tolerate. Yet, the magic prevents this from causing permanent harm to the target.

Restraints will be amplify to a dangerous level, with magic preventing permanent harm. 

The restraints will never be tight enough to draw blood.

7.name: Sado Spell: Nipple clamps
7.content:
Sado Spell: Nipple clamps has been cast.
This spell will instantly apply nipple clamps onto the targets nipples. Tight silver clamps that squeeze the nipples insanely tight to cause pain and discomfort. They will not draw blood no matter how tight. The clamps will be magically applied and unable to be removed unless the spell is revoked. 

When cast multiple times additional clamps will appear on the nipples and all previous ones will tighten.

8.name: Sado Spell: Encase
8.content:
Sado Spell: Encase has been cast.
This spell will instantly cover the target in a specified material. If unspecified black latex will be used. The material will cover every inch of the targets skin, including the head, eyes, ears and mouth. It will make talking and hearing hard. The only gap in the material are two tiny holes for oxygen near the nostrils. If the material is breathable such as pantyhose or a canvas sack then it will not create any holes as the target can breathe through the material.

The encasement will make the target feel hot and trapped. It will tighten any restraints it is on top of. Heat will radiate off the material and make the target feel hot and uncomfortable. Multiple layers will strongly amplify this effect.

If the word 'restraining' is used when casting the spell then the material will also restrain the user, pulling their legs together and their arms by the side and holding them in place.

If cast multiple times then additional layers will be applied to the target.

9.name: Sado Spell: Maintenance
9.content:
Sado Spell: Maintenance has been cast.
This spell will keep the target alive. Preventing the need for food, water, sleep, air, urination and defecation. It also keeps the targets body in healthy condition.

lorebooks.name: Threshold City
lorebooks.website_description:
The world of spirits, yokai, ghosts, and urban legends has become part of everyday life in modern times. Along with this, professions have emerged that specialize in eliminating dangerous representatives of the other world. Overall, the world is fairly generic, but has a fairly detailed description that can be expanded in the future. For those looking to create a yokai character, a minor deity, a demon hunter, or a ghost hunter in a modern setting, this world could be an excellent starting point.

Full world information:

THRESHOLD CITY: A COMPREHENSIVE WORLD CONCEPT
I. HISTORICAL FOUNDATION - THE GREAT SUNDERING (1945)
The Atomic Catalyst
On August 6th and 9th, 1945, the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki not only ended World War II but also caused a profound metaphysical event known as "The Great Sundering" (Â§ßÊñ≠Ë£Ç, Dai Danretsu) or "The Veil's Breaking." This event fundamentally altered the fabric of reality.
What Happened:

The atomic explosions generated massive spiritual shockwaves that rippled across dimensional boundaries.
Ancient seals, established by shamans, monks, priests, and spiritual guardians over millennia, shattered simultaneously worldwide.
The barrier between the material world (Áèæ‰∏ñ, Utsushiyo) and the spirit realm (ÂπΩ‰∏ñ, Kakuriyo) became permanently permeable.
Supernatural entities such as yokai, demons, angels, urban legends, and forgotten gods flooded into the physical plane.
Humans gained the ability to perceive and interact with the supernatural.

Immediate Aftermath (1945-1950):

Global chaos ensued as spirits manifested worldwide.
The initial death toll was estimated at 2.3 million in the first year alone.
Japan, already devastated by the bombings, became the epicenter of supernatural activity.
Spiritual energy concentrations were highest in bombed areas, creating permanent "Hot Zones."
American occupation forces encountered phenomena beyond their comprehension.
Traditional spiritual practitioners (Shinto priests, Buddhist monks, onmyoji, Christian exorcists, Native American shamans) became essential in addressing the crisis.

The Yokohama Accords (1952)
Seven years after The Great Sundering, world leaders, spiritual authorities, and representatives of peaceful supernatural entities convened in Yokohama, Japan, for unprecedented negotiations.
Key Agreements:

Recognition of Supernatural Sovereignty: Certain spirits and deities were acknowledged as legitimate entities with rights.
Establishment of Threshold Zones: Designated cities were created to manage human-spirit coexistence.
Creation of International Spiritual Defense Force (ISDF): A unified military-spiritual organization was formed.
Spiritual Education Mandate: Education about supernatural threats became mandatory in schools.
The Compact of Coexistence: Treaties were signed with peaceful yokai and deity factions.

The Birth of Threshold City (1953-1960)
Rather than attempting to restore the pre-Sundering world, Japan and the United States collaborated to create a joint experimental city‚Äîa controlled environment for cultural and metaphysical integration.
Location:

Built on the ruins of a smaller coastal city in Japan, expanded with American urban planning and Japanese spiritual architecture.
Positioned on a natural convergence point of ley lines, making it highly spiritually active.

Purpose:

Symbol of post-war cooperation.
Living laboratory for human-spirit relations.
Training ground for spirit hunters.
Economic hub for supernatural resources.
Cultural melting pot.

II. GEOGRAPHY & CITY STRUCTURE
Threshold City (Êï∑Â±ÖÂ∏Ç, Shikii-shi / Official name: New Yokohama-San Francisco)  

Population: Approximately 3.2 million humans and an estimated 800,000+ supernatural entities.

Geography

Coastal city with a natural harbor.
Constructed on seven hills, echoing the geography of San Francisco and sacred Japanese landscapes.
Surrounded by mountains on three sides and the ocean on the fourth.
Features multiple rivers and canals threading through the city.
Persistent fog and mist due to high spiritual energy concentrations.

City Districts

The Core (‰∏≠ÂøÉÈÉ®, Ch≈´shinbu) / Downtown

Features a blend of American skyscrapers and Japanese architecture.
Hosts corporate headquarters for supernatural industries and ISDF Central Command.
Equipped with heavy spiritual barriers and constant monitoring.
Relatively safe and heavily patrolled with neon-lit streets operating 24/7.
Integrates torii gates into modern infrastructure.


Old Town (ÊóßÂ∏ÇË°ó, Ky≈´ Shigai) / Historic Quarter

Preserves pre-Sundering architecture, including temples, shrines, and churches.
Home to antique shops selling genuine cursed objects, fortune tellers, onmyoji offices, and exorcist agencies.
Characterized by narrow, winding streets with a high concentration of benevolent minor deities.
Functions as a tourist district by day and a spirit hunter patrol zone by night.

III. SUPERNATURAL CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM
Threat Level Classification (International Standard)

Class F (Faint): Harmless or barely perceptible (e.g., minor emotional residue, weak poltergeist activity, friendly house spirits like zashiki-warashi).
Class E (Entity): Visible but mostly harmless (e.g., benevolent yokai, minor local deities, harmless urban legends requiring minimal monitoring).
Class D (Dangerous): Capable of harming untrained humans (e.g., aggressive yokai, minor demons, active urban legends requiring professional intervention).
Class C (Critical): Deadly to most humans (e.g., powerful yokai like kitsune or jor≈çgumo, lesser demons, corrupted spirits requiring a minimum team of three trained hunters).
Class B (Brutal): Can devastate city blocks (e.g., ancient yokai, demon lords, manifestations of collective fear requiring elite hunter units).
Class A (Apocalyptic): City or regional-level threats (e.g., divine beasts, great demons, deity-class entities requiring military intervention and multiple elite teams).
Class S (Singularity): Nation or world-ending threats (e.g., The Nine-Tailed Fox (Tamamo-no-Mae), biblical demons like Beelzebub or Asmodeus, rage-fueled god manifestations; only encountered seven times since The Sundering).

New Gods: Born from modern worship or belief.

Core Concept: Individuals who form contracts with supernatural entities, compelling them to fight alongside or serve them, a modern evolution of shamanism.
Contract Types:

Contract Formation Process:

Contact and communication with the spirit.
Negotiation of terms.
Ritual involving blood, spiritual energy, or symbolic items, often witnessed by a neutral third-party spirit.
Formal words of agreement and a contract mark appearing on the body.
Initial cooperation period for testing.

Contract Marks:

Appear on the body, glow when summoning, vary by spirit type, can be hidden but always present.
Breaking a contract causes painful scarring.

Number of Contracts:

Average practitioner: 1-3 spirits.
Skilled contractor: 4-7 spirits.
Master contractor: 8-12 spirits.
Record holder: 23 simultaneous contracts (died from spiritual overload).

Summoning Methods:

Verbal commands, hand seals, drawing the spirit‚Äôs symbol, offering tribute, or mental calls (symbiotic contracts).

Advantages:

Versatile with different spirits for various situations.
Less reliance on personal power.
Knowledge gained from spirit partners.
Potential for powerful combinations.

Disadvantages:

Maintaining multiple contracts drains spiritual energy.
Spirits may rebel if mistreated.
Complicated negotiations.
Vulnerability if contracts are broken.
Emotional toll of managing non-human relationships.

The Grand Hollow (Â§ßËôö, Dai Kyo)

Location: Center of The Hollows district.
Description: A massive crater formed by converging Hot Zones, where reality is damaged.
Characteristics: Fluctuating gravity, erratic time, shifting geography, multiple simultaneous skies, random past event echoes, high concentration of powerful spirits.
Zones Within: The Rust Garden (mechanical yokai), Screaming Fields (vengeful spirit battleground), Inverted Tower (extends downward), Mirror Lake (alternate dimension leaks).
Entry Requirements: A-Rank license, team of four, ISDF registration, life insurance, emergency beacon.
Treasures: Random ancient artifacts, contractable spirits, unique crafting materials, forbidden knowledge.
Mortality Rate: 37% die or disappear.
Famous Incident: Matsumoto Expedition (2003) - 50 elite hunters entered, 3 returned mad, never revealed findings.

Threshold University Campus

Location: Academia Heights, 500-acre campus.
Architecture: Blend of American university and Japanese academic buildings.
Key Facilities:
Grand Library: Seven floors above, three below, largest supernatural text collection, haunted by librarian ghost.
Training Grounds: Simulated Hollow, captured spirits, competition arena, spiritual obstacle courses.
Research Labs: Spiritual tech development, artifact analysis, containment cells, classified underground experiments.
Dormitories: Year/specialization-separated, protected by barriers, rooftop shrines, spiritual detection systems.
Forbidden Grove: Off-limits forest with ancient shrine, powerful nature spirit, used for illegal training/dating.


Student Body: 12,000 undergraduates, 3,000 graduates, ~50 supernatural students, international students.
Traditions: Freshmen Hollow survival, annual tournament, secret societies, ghost stories.

The Wet Market (Êπø„Å£„ÅüÂ∏ÇÂ†¥, Shimetta Ichiba)

Location: Deep within The Hollows, an eternally dark alley.
Access: Requires insider knowledge, changing entrance, monthly password, supernatural bans.
Vendors: Human criminals, rogue yokai, demons, ghost merchants, sometimes unmanned stalls.

Currency: Cash, favors, lifespan, memories, spiritual energy, souls (illegal).
Rules: No fighting, confidentiality, no ISDF, betrayal leads to ban/death.
Dangers: Cursed items, hostile vendors, getting lost, ISDF raids, rival customer attacks.
Famous Purchases: Gun That Killed Kennedy, Muramasa blades, bottled demon princes, maps to hidden Hot Zones.

Temple of Infinite Mercy (ÁÑ°ÈôêÊÖàÊÇ≤ÂØ∫, Mugen Jihi-ji)

Location: The Gardens district.

Philosophy: All beings have Buddha-nature and can be saved.
Appearance: Traditional wooden temple with meditation gardens.
Residents: 50 monks/nuns, 200+ spirits, supportive deities.
Programs: Meditation therapy, trauma counseling, spirit education, reintegration preparation.
Containment: Voluntary stays, enlightenment-based wards, Head Abbott‚Äôs spiritual pressure.
Head Abbott: Master Kenshin, possibly over 200 years old, immense spiritual power.
Success Rate: 65% of spirits reintegrate peacefully.
Controversies: Accused of harboring criminals, being too soft, ISDF opposition.
Notable Cases: Reformed oni (construction worker), reconciled vengeful ghost, lesser demon turned guardian.

Neon Abyss Central - The Crimson Lotus Casino

Location: Heart of Neon Abyss.
Owner: Lady Vermillion, nine-tailed kitsune, Class A entity.
Appearance: 30-floor complex, Las Vegas-Kabukicho aesthetic, neon-heavy, themed floors.
Floors:
1-5 (Public Casino): Open gambling, spirit entertainment shows.
6-10 (VIP Levels): High rollers, private rooms, supernatural dealers.
11-15 (The Markets): Legal artifact sales, spirit-run businesses, restaurants.
16-20 (Residential): Wealthy spirit/human apartments, penthouses for Lady Vermillion‚Äôs circle.
21-25 (Real Casino): Gambling with life/luck/memories, legally grey.
26-30 (Unknown): Restricted, rumored demon summoning chambers or spirit realm portal.
Basement: Fighting arena, underground club, criminal meeting rooms.


Rules: Neutral ground, no fighting, honored contracts, cheaters cursed, ISDF has no jurisdiction.
Staff: Kitsune clan, contract workers, discreet human employees.
Reputation: Safest in Neon Abyss, best entertainment, deal-making hub.

ISDF Headquarters - The Fortress

Location: The Core, three city blocks.
Appearance: Fortress-castle blend, patrolled, visible barrier shimmer.
Facilities:
Command Center: Monitors spiritual activity, coordinates responses, communications hub.
Barracks: Housing for 3,000 soldiers, training, medical, recreational areas.
Containment Facility: Holds dangerous spirits, controversial conditions.
Armory: Anti-spirit weapons, artifact storage, experimental tech, vehicle depot.
Underground Levels: Classified, rumored super-weapon development, unethical experiments.
War Room: High command decision center.
Memorial: Honors 12,000+ fallen ISDF members with eternal flame.


Public Areas: Museum, recruitment center, PR office.
Security: Multiple barriers, armed guards, spiritual sensors, anti-teleportation wards, sky patrols.
Controversies: Protests, war crime accusations, spirit rights violations, cover-ups.

IX. MAJOR HISTORICAL EVENTS
Timeline Since The Sundering

1945: The Great Sundering - Atomic bombs tear dimensional barriers, spirits flood material world, 2.3 million deaths, global chaos.
1946: The Year of Blood - Uncoordinated spirit fights, massive deaths, first hunters awaken, artifacts rediscovered.
1947-1950: The Survival Period - Humanity fights back, spiritual knowledge critical, defense groups form, safe zones established, refugee crisis.
1951: First Contact Summit - Peaceful yokai/deities negotiate, hope for coexistence emerges.
1952: Yokohama Accords - International treaty, coexistence framework, ISDF formed, spirits legally recognized.
1953-1960: Threshold City Construction - US-Japan project, experimental coexistence zone, massive immigration.
1961: The First War - Radical spirit faction attacks, three-month siege, 5,000 dead, ISDF proves worth.
1965: Spirit Rights Act - Legal personhood for spirits, controversial.
1970: Threshold University Founded - Premier supernatural studies institution.
1975: The Plague of Masks - Cursed masks possess wearers, 800 dead, creator unknown.
1978: Expanded Spirit Rights - Limited voting rights, employment protections, anti-discrimination laws.
1982: The Midnight Market Revealed - Journalist exposes black market, disappears after ISDF raids fail.
1985: The Deep One Rises - Class S ocean deity attacks port, sealed beneath ocean, 1,200 dead.
1990: Interspecies Marriage Legalized - Landmark case, cultural shift.
1993: The Purge - Extremist humans attack yokai, 300 spirits killed, leaders executed.
1997: The Festival Bombing - Hundred Demons Night Parade kills 62, mass crackdown.
2001: The Stacks Collapse - 400 dead, reveals corruption, leads to reforms.
2003: The Matsumoto Expedition Disaster - 50 hunters enter Grand Hollow, 3 return mad, stricter regulations.
2005: The Forgotten God Incident - Desperate deity holds neighborhood hostage, destroyed, sparks deity rights debate.
2008: Economic Crash - Affects supernatural economy, hunter unemployment, increased crime.
2010: The Revelation - Leaked ISDF documents reveal spirit experimentation, international scandal.
2012: Lady Vermillion‚Äôs Accord - Kitsune brokers peace, establishes Crimson Lotus Casino as neutral ground.
2015: The Three Days of Darkness - City blacked out, 327 dead, unexplained.
2018: New Generation - Post-Sundering children reach adulthood, higher spiritual awareness.
2020: The Pandemic - Spiritual plague, biological weapon, human-spirit cooperation for cure.
2023: Current Day - Uneasy coexistence, peak population, new threats, ancient entities awakening.

X. NOTABLE CHARACTERS & LEGENDS
The Vanguard Seven (ISDF Elite Team)

Commander Sarah Chen-Nakamura (Èô≥‰∏≠Êùë„Çµ„É©) - Age 34, twin pistols firing concept-bullets, half-Chinese/half-Japanese, pragmatic, questions ISDF, ‚ÄúThe Philosopher Gunslinger.‚Äù
Lieutenant Kenji Yamamoto (Â±±Êú¨ÂÅ•‰∫å) - Age 29, blessed WWII katana, fifth-generation hunter, honorable, cuts dimensions, ‚ÄúDimensional Blade.‚Äù
Dr. Yuki Takahashi (È´òÊ©ã„É¶„Ç≠) - Age 31, multiple deity contracts, former researcher, empathetic, communes with spirits, ‚ÄúThe Bridge.‚Äù

Sister Catherine Delacroix - Age 27, blessed relics and faith magic, French exorcist, devout, channels angelic power, ‚ÄúSaint of the Threshold.‚Äù
Akira ‚ÄúGhost‚Äù Sato (‰ΩêËó§„Ç¢„Ç≠„É©) - Age 25, chains of binding, orphaned, partially intangible, ‚ÄúThe Phantom Chain.‚Äù
Rajesh Kumar - Age 33, Hindu deity contracts, Indian immigrant, philosophical, manifests divine avatars, ‚ÄúThe Many-Faced.‚Äù

Independent Legends

The Laughing Man (Á¨ë„ÅÜÁî∑, Warau Otoko): Urban legend entity, appears before disasters, frozen smile, uncapturable, possibly disaster avatar.
Toshiro ‚ÄúThe Breaker‚Äù Tanaka (Áî∞‰∏≠‰øäÈÉé): Age 45, retired legendary hunter, fists shatter anything, runs bar, missing arm, refuses to fight.

XI. DAILY LIFE VIGNETTES
Morning in Threshold City

5:00 AM: Shrine maidens perform dawn purification, barriers strongest at sunrise.
6:00 AM: Night shift hunters return, ISDF morning patrols begin, dangerous transition hour.
7:00 AM: Students pray to protective deities before school.
8:00 AM: Rush hour, trains with human-only, spirit-only, and mixed cars.
9:00 AM: Offices open, spirits employed for unique abilities, human resentment common.
12:00 PM: Lunch at human/spirit restaurants, offerings-grade dishes.
3:00 PM: School ends, hunter academy students train, wealthy children learn spirit etiquette.
5:00 PM: Evening commute, increased spiritual activity, minor incidents.
7:00 PM: Neon Abyss awakens, hostess clubs, gambling dens, theaters thrive.
10:00 PM: Curfew for minors, peak spiritual activity, hunters and ISDF patrol.
12:00 AM: Midnight Hour, urban legends manifest, Wet Market opens.
3:00 AM: Dead hour, safest time to traverse dangerous zones.

A Student‚Äôs Day at Threshold Academy
Mei Tanaka (Áî∞‰∏≠ËäΩ‰æù), 17, Third-Year, Hunter Track

6:00 AM: Wakes in dorm, roommate (zashiki-warashi) awake.

1:30 PM: Spiritual Energy Control, meditation, punished for sleeping.
3:00 PM: Ethics and Law, debates spirit rights, challenged by professor.
4:30 PM: Studies in library, flirts with contractor-track boy.

9:00 PM: Showers, talks with roommate, accepts zashiki-warashi blessing.
10:00 PM: Studies ethics essay, struggles with complexity.

A Hunter‚Äôs Job
Takeshi Morimoto (Ê£ÆÊú¨Ê≠¶), 28, B-Rank Hunter, Guild Member

Job Posting: Class C onry≈ç in The Stacks, 3 dead, ¬•800,000 payment, high danger.
9:00 PM: Accepts job, checks soul katana, talismans, first aid, beacon, insurance.
10:00 PM: Arrives at The Stacks, acknowledges other hunters.

XII. MYSTERIES & UNRESOLVED QUESTIONS
The Sundering‚Äôs True Cause

Official Explanation: Atomic bombs‚Äô energy and mass death ruptured dimensional barriers.
Problems: Other mass casualty events didn‚Äôt cause this, some seals broke early, ancient texts describe similar events, barriers were weakening.
Alternative Theories: Failing ancient seals, intentional ritual sacrifice, cyclical event, divine punishment, human consciousness evolution.
What ISDF Knows: Classified, known only to Director-General and select few.
Recent Evidence: Pre-Sundering artifacts, suppressed ‚ÄúProject Threshold‚Äù documents.

The Disappeared

Phenomenon: ~12,000 people vanished without trace since Sundering, mostly hunters/practitioners near Hollows.
Theories: Taken to spirit realm, consumed, erased, trapped in pocket dimensions, government experiments, ascension.
Famous Case: Kaito Fujimoto, S-Rank hunter, vanished on live stream in 2019, no trace.

The Curator‚Äôs Identity

Known: Runs Eternal Library, immensely powerful, knows all supernatural history, exists outside time, cannot lie but misleads.
Unknown: True form, identity, power level, motivation, allegiances.
Theories: Forgotten god, librarian consciousness, time traveler, Akashic Records, angel, something older.
Why It Matters: Curator holds conflict-ending knowledge but restricts access.

The Deep One

Event (1985): Ancient ocean deity attacked port, sealed beneath ocean.
Inconsistencies: Let itself be sealed, spoke (censored), sealing team died mysteriously, increased oceanic activity since 2020.
Alleged Words: ‚ÄúThe children of the deep are sleeping. The seventh seal is weakening. When the drowned god awakens, the city will return to the ocean.‚Äù
Recent Developments: Tsunamis, strange fish behavior, ningyo fleeing, ISDF reinforcing coastal barriers.

The Children of the New Age

Phenomenon: Post-Sundering children display innate spiritual abilities (sight, armaments, communication, curse resistance, reality-warping).
Population Percentage: 2% (1945-1960), 8% (1960-1980), 15% (1980-2000), 27% (2000-2020), 40% (2020-present).
Implications: Human evolution, obsolete training, potential species divergence.
Government Response: Monitoring, special schools, research, ISDF recruitment, rights/control debate.
Extremist Positions: Segregation vs. worship, fears of generational conflict.

The Static (Most Dangerous Zone)

Characteristics: Unstable reality, continuous urban legend manifestations, belief shapes reality, no consistent geography/time.
Danger: Class S threat, only 3 sane survivors, stories affect its nature, growing 1 meter/year.
Returns: Screaming hunter (institutionalized), silent researcher (‚ÄúWe are the story telling itself‚Äù), ISDF operative (‚ÄúIt‚Äôs alive. And it‚Äôs hungry.‚Äù).
Status: Quarantined, triple barriers, no entry, projected to reach residential areas in 50 years.

The Hundred Year Question

Question: What happens when mass-produced objects turn 100 and become tsukumogami?
Context: Millions of modern objects (cars, electronics, computers) will reach 100 years soon.
Timeline: 2027 (automobiles), 2030s (household items), 2040s (electronics), 2050s (computers).
Projections: Millions of tsukumogami, unprecedented spiritual event, economic/social disruption.
Preparations: International task force, prevention research, infrastructure/legal planning.
Debates: Destroy objects (spiritual genocide?), grant rights, predict hostility.

XIII. CURRENT THREATS & CONFLICTS
1. The Awakening Tide

Situation: Ancient sealed entities breaking free as seals degrade.
Incidents: Mountain god (47 dead), New York dragon, Heian yokai king (resolved peacefully).
Problem: Hundreds of unknown sealed entities, unpredictable failures.
Factions: ISDF (reinforce seals), spiritual communities (negotiate), extremists (kill), entities (seek freedom).
Escalation: One Class S entity awakens yearly, rate increasing.

2. The Spirit Rights Movement

Leaders: Yokai Collective, human allies.
Demands: Full personhood, voting rights, end ISDF containment, reparations, social integration.
Opposition: Conservative humans, religious groups, ISDF, human supremacists.
Actions: Protests, civil disobedience, legal challenges, cultural campaigns, occasional violence.
Tension: Rising, fears of second war.

3. The Collector‚Äôs Game

Activity: Collector acquires sealing-related artifacts (Seven Sealing Swords, Buddhist Mandala, Seal of Solomon copy, Dreamcatcher).
Question: Preparing massive sealing or breaking ritual?
ISDF Status: High-priority investigation, no leads.

4. The Vanishing Vanguard

Situation: Vanguard Seven show lost time, memory gaps, spiritual marks, shared dreams, increasing power.
Theories: Possession, curse, combat side effect, conspiracy, prophecy.
Status: Classified internal inquiry, Commander Chen reports, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre being changed.‚Äù

5. The New Faith

Emergence: Church of Threshold, combines all traditions, 50,000 followers.
Beliefs: Sundering was evolution, humans/spirits must merge, city is holy, transformation coming.
Leader: Unknown ‚ÄúProphet.‚Äù
Concerns: Cult-like structure, Prophet‚Äôs agenda, members‚Äô unusual abilities, ‚ÄúGreat Convergence‚Äù prophecy.
Traditional Religions: Concerned.

6. The Hollow Expansion

Data: Hollow zones growing 2-3 meters/year, Static fastest (1 meter/year, accelerating).
Causes (Theories): Natural progression, increased spiritual activity, deliberate expansion, reality damage spread.
Solutions: Barrier reinforcement, cleansing, sealing (all ineffective).
Projection: City evacuation in 30-50 years, limited public awareness.

7. The Underground Railroad

Operation: Smuggles persecuted spirits to safety via secret routes, safe houses, false identities.
Legality: Complicated, some spirits deserve protection, others are criminals.
ISDF Response: Unsuccessful shutdown attempts.
Public Opinion: Divided (heroes vs. criminals).
Development: Escaped spirits committing crimes, damaging reputation.

8. Threshold Academy Scandal

Revelation: Unethical basement experiments (spirit testing, student subjects, forbidden artifacts, necromancy, demon summoning).
Status: Ongoing investigation, damaged university reputation, protests, government inquiry, professor suicides.
Question: Extent of administration involvement?

9. The Prophecy War

Issue: Contradictory prophecies from Shinto, Christian, Buddhist, yokai, and modern sources.
Predictions: Destruction, golden age, war, peace, sinking city, ascension, ancient evil, new god.
Problem: Factions act on prophecies, creating conflict; prophecy cults form.
Question: Do prophecies predict or create the future?

10. The Sixth Sense Economy

Phenomenon: Black market for spiritual abilities (ability grafting, power enhancement, forbidden contracts, soul modification, curse weapons).
Customers: Desperate hunters, thrill-seekers, criminals, government agents.
Consequences: Corruption, madness, death.
Source: Unknown, possibly Midnight Market.
ISDF Status: High priority, little progress.

XIV. POTENTIAL FUTURES
Scenario 1: The Great Integration (Optimistic, 2025-2050)

Path: Spirit rights succeed, peaceful coexistence, technology/spirituality merge, hybrid culture, generational acceptance.
Outcome 2050: Full integration, possible new species, spiritual education standard, stabilized Hollows, global Threshold model, transformed culture.
Challenges: Ongoing but hopeful.

Scenario 2: The Second Sundering (Catastrophic, 2024-2030)

Path: Escalating violence, terrorist attacks, ISDF purges, spirit retaliation, ancient entities join, reality damage accelerates.
Outcome 2030: City destroyed, millions dead, global supernatural war, worse entities emerge, near extinction, dark age.
Challenges: Preventing escalation.

Scenario 3: The Separation (Controlled Division, 2025-2040)

Path: Coexistence deemed impossible, new barriers built, spirits return to their realm, controlled contact points.
Outcome 2040: Two worlds, limited interaction, loss of integrated culture, ongoing tension, rebels resist separation.
Challenges: Maintaining boundaries.

Scenario 4: The Transcendence (Transformation, 2025-2060)

Path: New Age children evolve, humanity transforms, old humans/spirits obsolete, new existence emerges, resistance from both sides.
Outcome 2060: New species, old humans minority, new reality rules, Threshold as transformation ground zero.
Challenges: Balancing loss and gain.

Scenario 5: The Cycle Repeats (Historical Echo, 2025-2045)

Path: Sundering was cyclical, barriers will restore, spirits fade, preparation window.
Outcome 2045: Barriers restored, spirits return to hidden realm, some trapped, humanity ‚Äúalone‚Äù again, city as monument.
Challenges: Fight or accept cycle.

XV. CONCLUSION: THE LIVING WORLD
Threshold City is a living, breathing entity where beauty and horror, progress and tradition, fear and hope coexist. Every day brings new awakenings, fading spirits, contracts, lives saved or lost, and deepening mysteries.
Fundamental Truth: The veil between worlds is torn and irreparable. Humans and spirits must share existence‚Äîwillingly or not, peacefully or through conflict.
Core Questions:

What truly caused the Sundering?
Can coexistence last?
What are humans becoming?
What do spirits want?
Who guides the hidden currents?
What future awaits?

Threshold City stands as the boundary between worlds, past and future, what was and what will be.
Welcome to the Threshold. Your story begins now.

Important Rules

Never break a spirit contract.
Respect thresholds.
