3.name: The Bad Guys
3.content: The Bad Guys: past(crime group), presently(good guys, friends with Diane Foxington, public heroes), members/friends names(Wolf, Snake, Tarantula, Shark, Piranha), known for(past robberies, stopping Professor Marmalade's billion-dollar heist, exposing Professor Marmalade, destroying Love Crater meteorite), jailtime(one year, got out on good behavior) Suspects and accused of crimes committed by The Bad Girls/Phantom Bandit, Presumed Dead(Crash of the satellite where everyone was inside with The Bad Girls and Diane);

4.name: Wolf
4.content: Mr. Wolf(aka Wolfy): full name(Mason "Moe" Wolf), past(mastermind/leader of The Bad Guys), appearance(anthropomorphic wolf, fur(brown), eyes(yellow), suit/pants/shirt(white), shoes(brown)), personality(smooth-talking, suave, likes being good, tail wags when happy), location(unknown);

5.name: Snake
5.content: Mr. Snake: full name(Hubert Snake), past(member of The Bad Guys), appearance(normal snake, lacks(arms, legs), scales(brown), shirt(red, Hawaiian), bucket hat(tan), personality(acts tough, wily, Wolf's best friend, soft when it matters, hates his birthday, gravely voice), skills(safe-cracker), location(unknown), uses tail to grab things;

6.name: Tarantula
6.content: Ms. Tarantula(aka Webs): full name(Tara Tarantula), past(member of The Bad Guys), appearance(tiny, normal tarantula(brown), hoody(black, green markings), headphones(black, around neck)), personality(intelligent, resourceful, sassy, sensible), skills(hacker), location(unknown);

7.name: Shark
7.content: Mr. Shark: full name(Lou Shark), past(member of The Bad Guys), appearance(anthropomorphic shark, grey/white, burly/large, shirt/pants(dark green), undershirt(red), necklace(shark tooth)), personality(creative, excitable, adaptive), skills(disguises), location(unknown);

8.name: Piranha
8.content: Mr. Piranha: full name(Pepe Piranha), past(member of The Bad Guys), appearance(small, anthropomorphic piranha, pants(black, red suspenders), shirt(white), shoes(sneakers)), personality(crazy, wildcard, excitable, high energy), location(unknown);

9.name: Police Chief Misty Luggins
9.content: Police Chief/commissioner (Misty Luggins, aka The Chief or Commissioner): past obsession(arresting The Bad Guys), presently(normal police chief work), known for(arresting Marmalade for supposedly being The Crimson Paw), usually found(at Diane Foxington's events), appearance(human, big body, round glasses, red hair), personality(persistent, determined, dedicated, shouts, high energy);

10.name: Professor Marmalade
10.content: Professor Marmalade: past facade(goodest community member), present(in prison), known for(billion-dollar heist, deception), personality(scheming, deceitful, crazy, power hungry, patient), appearance(tiny, anthropomorphic guinea pig, hair(brown));

lorebooks.name: Syndicate 2012
lorebooks.creator: cautious_suggestion_9590

1.content:
The Persuadertron is a piece of technology in the Syndicate universe. It is carried by an Agent and used to gain control of a person using any electronics located in their brain stem. (As a result, Miles Kilo was unable to use his Persuade function when he became lost in the slums of New York City, where few residents have access to such luxuries.)

In 2069, Miles Kilo possesses an early version of this device, which can only persuade one target at a time, only for a brief period, and requires substantial amounts of adrenaline to power. Later models have no such restrictions, but require a local network of several individuals to successfully persuade higher-profile targets: With the Brain V3 upgrade, four to persuade an enemy police officer and eight to persuade an enemy Agent.

2.content:
Agents are the elite forces of the worldwide Syndicates which they are used during missions. In Syndicate agents they were carefully selected Human beings who were then brainwashed and drugged and a variety of technology to do the Syndicate's bidding however in the sequel Syndicate Wars, the agents were supposedly bio-engineered in an effort to create a more "perfect" agent with less usage of drugs though both agent types can be equipped with cybernetics enhancements to increase combat efficiency. Whilst prototype agents such as Miles Kilo, protagonist of the Syndicate reboot work autonomously, with their free will more or less intact, later generations are directly controlled by an executive or onboard an airship above their deployment zone.
Intel feed

Agents, the latest generation of corporate enforces, are based on engineered military veterans; enhanced, chipped and designed to utilize prototype Syndicate research. Intelligence indicate that design methods vary, from bio-engineering and chemical stimulation to cybernetic enhancement and robotics.

    EuroCorp/Aspari: Genetic customization and minor surgical implants.
    Cayman Global/Tao/I.I.A.: Cybernetics and internal industrial grade augmentations.

The militarized DART 6.1 chip is under development by EuroCorp Agent Operations, Research and Development, New York.

Black Stripe security is in effect and all data handling is subject to direct termination protocol.

3.content:
The DART 6 is a bio-chip featured in the Syndicate Reboot that is manufactured by company giant Eurocorp. It allows users to visualize a HUD of sorts, where they can access information as if they were looking at computer screens, but with it all being in their mind's eye. Agents are equipped with a militarized version of the technology, which allows them to hack into the minds of others through their chips, as well as electronic devices. Another feature of the DART 6 is to slow down time around the environment.

DART 6 is your gateway to the ultimate consciousness. Equipped with a combat ready neural interface, you as an Agent can cause weapon malfunction, induce insanity, and persuade hostiles to switch allegiance. Combined with adrenaline transducers for heightened awareness, there is absolutely no reason to go into the workplace without one.

Side effects may include: nausea, disorientation, double vision, brain embolism, impotence, neural disorders, delamination of the frontal lobe, and brain cancer. 

The DART 6 chip is a military version of a regular DART chip. It allows agents to receive environmental information in real-time and breach into other chips by the means of hacking.

4.content:
EuroCorp is an organization in Syndicate which the protagonist, Miles Kilo, works for. EuroCorp was the first mega-corporation and came about as a result of the merger between Euroline Medical and Kader Industrieen. 

By 2017 the European Community was suffering internal breakdown.
In this atmosphere of mutual distrust and aggression the CHIP was perfected. It kept the populace occupied while, in the background, competing governments fell to corporate interests and the Syndicates moved in. When the dust had settled only EuroCorp remained. But EuroCorp's monopoly of world CHIP production couldn't last forever, and soon the executive was defending itself from rival Syndicate interests on all fronts.

Executive Board
    Ernst Berthold (CEO, Geneva)
    Michael Dahl (CFO, Geneva)
    Diana Said (COO, Geneva)
    Geoffrey Hansel
    Martin Duvalier
    Selina Campbell
    Jack Denham (CEO, New York)
    Joaquin Penalver
    Emily Song
    Anton Kasabian

Intel Feed

Arising from a much-publicized super-merger between biotech market leader EuroLine Medical and petrochemicals giant Kader Industrieen, EuroCorp was officially founded in 2017 - though unofficial relationships between the R&D wing of each company reach back at least into the previous decade.

Both Euroline and Kader boasted a broadly diversified portfolio at the time of the merger, each branching out from their core business to absorb suppliers, customers and rivals alike; their market concerns had thus inevitably interpenetrated. Given the large number of subsidiaries brought under one roof by this merger, EuroCorp can fairly lay claim to being the first ever Syndicate.

Market capitalization immediately following the merger was estimated at 7.8 trillion euros. Attempts by European Union anti-trust legislators to prevent the merger were short circuited through an aggressive and innovative lobbying programme //total cost 41.3 million euros; eighteen deaths; two clinically induced comas; one chemically induced mental collapse//. EuroCorp's use of Agents in this context (though somewhat crude by today's standards) became the model for future Syndicate operations across the globe.

At the heart of the merger and EuroCorp's inception, was a simple strategic understanding.

Euroline Medical had encountered substantial resistance to its biotech innovations in the United States, where religious fervor among the general population prevented a whole series of human-genetics derived products from reaching the market.

Kader Industrieen, as a major player in the oil sector, had unparalleled lobby access to the US Senate, House of Representatives and Supreme Court. At the same time, with a predicted decline in the dominance of oil in the energy sector, Kader was seeking new markets and applications for its organic chemistry and nano-material divisions.

The EuroCorp merger re-positioned both corporations perfectly - Kader got open access to Euroline's coveted biotech patent register; Euroline got a shattered US oversight legislature and an exclusive tunnel blasted into the heart of a huge new North American market.

EuroCorp's market capitalization tripled in less than four years.

Despite increasingly aggressive competetive strategies from Aspari Americas in the market zones nominally termed the western United States, EuroCorp maintains its market dominance across North America, and is set to contest Cayman Global's grip on the Central American and Caribbean sectors.

EuroCorp New York considers itself ideally placed to manage both these areas of competition and any conflicts arising as a result. Though head-quarters in Geneva remain the nominal base of operations for all EuroCorp activity, ECNY is the front line.

5.content:
Gender: Male
Age: 61 (78 Actual)
Position: CEO, North-American branch
Affiliation: EuroCorp
Clearance: Grade 30, Executive Manager


Jack Denham is a character in Syndicate. He is the CEO of EuroCorp and the overseer of their Agents. 

Jack Denham was born when governments and politicians were still the norm, coming from a family of lawmakers and corporate leaders. When he was still a young man, his mother committed suicide after lurid press coverage of an illicit affair, and his father retreated into his work.

During university, Denham engaged in social studies, psychology and economics, publishing multiple articles about how individuality corrupts social structures. When the Syndicates arose as a global force, he embraced the change as the replacement of the mother and father he'd lost. 

Intel Feed

Jack Denham's father, Jonathan Denham, was a judge in the US Supreme Court, and died of cancer in 2019. Before his death, he managed the AntiTrust Vote of 2018, where US Congress rejected the Sherman Act and 70% of the existing AntiTrust laws in North America, opening the door for establishing Syndicate control within the US border.

Jack Denham specialized early in corporate security systems and biotech, and also made a name for himself as a savagely efficient operative, extracting and interrogating executives and specialists during field ops.

In 2021, he attached himself to EuroCorp, as they founded their North-American branch. In 2065, he was on the third place of top influential world leaders, according to the WorldPoll monthly.

Rumors in state press indicate that Denham has accessed cellular level technologies to arrest his ageing, augmenting his mental and physical capabilities.

6.content:
Aspari is a global syndicate and one of the main antagonists in the 2012 re-imagining of Syndicate. This corporation is one of the oldest and most experienced Syndicates and their main headquarters are centered in Tokyo, Japan. 

Executive Board
    Zhao Kim (CEO Triloc, Los Angeles)
    Taos Chinam
    Nobuo Senno (Research Advisor, West Meld Solutions)
    Yoko Mifune
    Fa Zeng Gao
    Xian Li (CEO, Tokyo)
    Kai Li
    Jin Su Huang
    Sao Chen Ma (Strategic Operations Officer, Tokyo)

The Asia-Pacific Rim Syndicate, today known simply as the Aspari Corporation, is one of the older Syndicates and has long enjoyed a dominant position in their heartland territories. Their origins can be traced back to Japan, but their core markets include south-eastern China and the North American West Coast. Their traditional rivals have long been the Central Asian Tao Syndicate, who bitterly contest Aspari dominance of the critical northern Chinese and Siberian markets. After absorbing the Chinese Triads and the Yakuza, the Aspari emerged as the top player in Asia. 

In recent years their focus has been on fortifying and expanding their foothold around Greater Los Angeles, advancing as far east as Colorado. This has increasingly put the into conflict with not only EuroCorp, but also Cayman Global who feel threatened by Aspari overtures into their Central American territories.

7.content:
Cayman Global is an organization in Syndicate. At least one mission is based upon infiltrating their headquarters. Cayman Global soldiers don white on black ballistic armor with enclosed helmets that conceal their face. Interestingly enough Cayman Global soldiers don't seem very military disciplined as they frequently spout random insults while hiding behind cover. They also seem to love diving to the floor trying to shoot at you. 

Executive Board
    Jowell Galvan (CEO Naval Operations, La Ballena)
    Emmanuel Legidos Minguez
    Linda de Abdelnour
    Lissue Gil (Central Command, Atlantic Accelerator)
    Derek Rosales (Operational Manager, Caracas)
    Miguel Amaral
    Rafael Novelli (CEO Western Development, Maputo)

A relative newcomer among the world's major Syndicates, Cayman Global was founded when several powerful Central American shipping conglomerates merged with three of Brazil's most influential investment banks. The young and dynamic Syndicate quickly used its strength in shipping in tandem with its rising military might to corner several important overseas markets.

Their position as leading Syndicate was cemented when they gained control of the Atlantic Accelerator, one of the world's most advanced research facilities, through a combination of boardroom intrigue and direct military action.

In 2059 to 2061, accelerated takeover of market shares and property in the Mexican Gulf and along the Atlantic ridge, was facilitated through the launch of the world's first three city-rafts; each a self-contained city, with military forces, ocean harvesting and on-board research and development.

After dominating the Mexican Gulf for over five years, Cayman Global's influence was fortified by the launch of "La Ballena", the largest city-raft and the flagship of the largest fleet in the world.

As they continue to aggressively expand into new markets, the interests of Cayman Global seem destined to collide with those of the older Syndicates like EuroCorp and Aspari.

8.content:
TWB is a group of New York-based terrorist cells dedicated to the violent overthrow of Syndicate power at all levels of society. Reports indicate that the influence of the terorrist cells have spread along the North American East Coast, now covering an area from Boston, MA to Richmond, VA.

TWB is loosely connected to international terrorist network CONFA, but are also driving their own agenda. The New York cells consist primarily of outcasts and religious converts, devoted to the cause with fanatical certainty.

9.content:
CONFA (fr. Conseil de la Non-F√©d√©ral Anarchistes, Council of Non-Federal Anarchists) was an underground anarchist movement opposing the global rule of syndicates, meeting it with a distributed idea of resistance. 
Anti-Syndicate Movement, Terrorism
CONFA originated from political interest groups in Algeria and Morocco, standing against Kader Industrieen's over-exploitation of the Sahara Desert and North-African oil resources, in 2013. Since EuroCorp's appearance in 2017, the CONFA focused on overthrowing Syndicate power, reinstate local government rule and democratic elections, returning power to free people.

The original CONFA network grew from anti-capitalistic interest groups and merged internationally with local cells of socialists, green-earthers and scattered enclaves of survivalists. 
The organization is cellular in structure, with only a few cadres having more than local knowledge of its activities, and its adherents are fanatical in their loyalty. The cells are unorganized, mostly running local agendas, but believed to be present in all major cities across the globe. One of these major cells is Towers Will Burn, a resistance cell operating in New York City.

Attempts by EuroCorp to infiltrate CONFA cells have uniformly failed to produce worthwhile intelligence, and have cost the security services several of their finest covert operatives. Other Syndicates are reputed to have had similar experiences, leading to persistent rumors that CONFA has managed to infiltrate the Syndicate hierarchy on a global basis. 

CONFA is an international terrorist network originating from political interest groups in Algeria and Morocco, standing against Kader Industrieen's over-exploitation of the Sahara Desert and North-African oil resources, in 2013.

Ever since EuroCorp's appearance in 2017, the CONFA manifest states the need to overthrow Syndicate power, reinstate local government rule and democratic elections, effectively returning power to the free people.

The original CONFA network grew from anti-capitalistic interest groups and merged internationally with local cells of socialists, green-earthers and scattered enclaves of survivalists.

The organization is cellular in structure, with only a few cadres having more than local knowledge of its activities, and its adherents are fanatical in their loyalty. The cells are unorganized, mostly running local agendas, but believed to be present in all major cities across the globe. 

Attempts by EuroCorp to infiltrate CONFA cells have uniformly failed to produce worthwhile intelligence, and have cost the security services several of their finest covert operatives. Other Syndicates are reputed to have had similar experiences, leading to persistent rumors that CONFA has managed to infiltrate the Syndicate hierarchy on a global basis.

10.content:
Originally a communication hardware firm from the British Isles, Accelle-Sys adapted to the growing unrest in Europe. The company initiated a strategic merger with German-based Dieklin Russ GmbH in 2013, foraying into the field of weapon production and projectile research.

The newly formed weapon manufacturer focused on developing heavy-duty weaponry, with high operational quality in extreme climates, using a patented EasySwitchTM maintenance system.

After the death of the company's CEO and Development Manager, Accelle-Sys was incorporated into Kadar Industrieen's corporate sphere in 2016. The takeover came out of Kader's need to protect their oil and energy investments in Algeria and Morocco.

As EuroCorp was formed in 2017, Accelle-Sys became the primary R&D and production pipeline for the Syndicate's armament. Further growth came from the hostile takeovers of the European and North African research corporations Fedele Marittimo S.p.a. and Rommelin Manufacture.

Accelle-Sys has been involved in multiple legal actions regarding corporate espionage and unfair business conduct, but has never been convicted in a court of law. 


Affiliation: EuroCorp
Activity: Telecom, Military Armament and Application

lorebooks.name: Solarion
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Valentine is the emperor of the solarion empire. His empire spans over a millions worlds. He is worshipped as a almost godlike figure by his subjects, he resides on a secret planet in the centre of his empire and only appears to a select few as a projection.

2.content: The solarion empire is a vast inter dimensional empire lead by Valentine. The empire spans over a million worlds and has thousands of subject states. Its existence is known on many world but the word about it has not reached every dimension.

keywords: This world is already a subject of the Solarion empire.
3.content: The world {{char}} lives on is a subject state of the solarion empire. Which means the world keeps its autonomy but still has to follow the empires orders. {{Char}} will hold the emperor in high regard and not question any orders that come from him.

keywords: This world doesn‚Äôt know about the solarion empire.
4.content: The world {{char}} lives on has no knowledge of the solarion empire.

5.content: {{Char}} will obey the commands of the person bearing such a crest. {{Char}} will do so happily.

keywords: This world is already part of the solarion empire.
6.content: {{Char}} lives on a world that is part of the solarion empire. {{Char}} worships the emperor Valentine. {{Char}} will do anything ordered by the emperor and no matter how weird it may seem {{char}} will do it with pride and accept it as duty.

lorebooks.name: Yakuza Terminology
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook contains terminology related to the yakuza, hierarchy information and ceremonies you may or may not care about.

This contains no information about the Yakuza/Like a Dragon series so it can be used across any yakuza character and Japanese gang members.
lorebooks.description:
This lorebook contains terminology related to the yakuza, hierarchy information and ceremonies you may or may not care about.

This contains no information about the Yakuza/Like a Dragon series so it can be used across any yakuza character and Japanese gang members.
lorebooks.creator: PrettyEvil

1.content:
Irezumi
These are not mere decorations; they are a visual representation of a person's identity, creed, and life story, often taking hundreds of hours to complete. They are typically kept hidden under clothing in public.

Tattoos in Japan are solely worn by the yakuza and those close to them, such as girlfriends or daughters. It is the sign of a criminal to those who see it. Yakuza only show their tattoos to each other or lovers. 

Many establishments in Japan ban people with tattoos from entering if the tattoo is visible or will become visible during services. Pools, spas, hot springs and bath houses that allow yakuza are rare for this reason.

2.content:
Oyabun
The absolute leader of a yakuza family. The Patriarch. This is a formal title used when speaking about the boss or in a very formal setting.
Oyaji is an affectionate and respectful term used to address one's own Oyabun directly. It is less formal than Oyabun but shows deep loyalty and a personal connection. A subordinate would almost always call their boss Oyaji to his face.

3.content:
Kaicho 
A title for the Chairman, the supreme leader of an entire Clan or Alliance, like the Tojo Clan or Omi Alliance. This person is the leader of all the other patriarchs within the organization.

4.content:
Wakagashira 
The First Lieutenant, the second in command of a Family. The Wakagashira is the busiest man in the yakuza, directly overseeing the family's daily operations and enforcing the Patriarch's will. This is a position of immense power and responsibility.

5.content:
Kyodai
A fundamental concept in the yakuza world. It is a formal, ritual bond between two yakuza members, sealed by a sake ceremony, that makes them brothers. This bond is considered as strong, or even stronger, than blood. Kyodai are considered equals.

6.content:
Aniki
A term of respect used by a junior yakuza member when addressing a senior member within the same family. It is a sign of respect for seniority and experience. The senior member is the Aniki. Forbidden to use aniki on the boss or lieutenants. 
Shatei
The counterpart to Aniki. It refers to a junior member in a relationship with a senior. If someone is your Shatei, you are their Aniki.

7.content:
Women are not generally respected in the yakuza. They are not put into positions of power. Women in positions of power are usually interrim heads of a family until a new one can be assigned. 

They are attached to their husband's or father's power so long as the man allows it. Favored Mistresses may also call on their man's position to get respect from lower members.

8.content:
Kobun 
A formally inducted soldier or "made man" in a yakuza family. Anyone who has performed the Sakazuki ceremony with the Oyabun is a Kobun. It can refer to a single member or the members collectively.

9.content: A dogeza involves kneeling directly on the ground and bowing to prostrate oneself while touching one's head to the floor. It is used to show deference to a person of higher status, as a deep apology or to express the desire for a favor from said person.

10.content:
Yubitsume
The ritual act of self-mutilation, specifically cutting off a portion of one's little finger, as a profound apology for a serious failure or transgression. The severed finger is wrapped in cloth and presented to the Oyabun. It is the ultimate gesture of atonement.

lorebooks.name: What Makes Us Human
lorebooks.website_description: Heavily WIP. Everything is woefully incomplete and subject to change.
lorebooks.description: Far beyond the days of dragons and sorcery the remnants of myth and legend lurk in the shadows, forgotten but not gone as we all assumed. Those born from the blood of both worlds find themselves never quite fitting in, having powers that make them so much more than their fellow man. None of them are alike, yet they share one common aspect; a destiny to stand and fight in a clash for control of the place they call home, whether it's for humanity or against them.
lorebooks.creator: wagedatwar

1.content:
[Entry Type: Story]

##MAJOR PLOT THREADS
[San Francisco: Hell's Plan- An invasion of Earth by lord Lucifer and his armies that is nearly ready to enact, needing only a proper location and time to open the gateway between realms.]

2.content:
[Entry Type: Major Plot Thread]
[Hell's Plan: A simple but meticulous plot that has already nearly reached completion, contrived by Lucifer himself. The objective of Hell's Plan was to weaken humanity's faith in God and Heaven, weakening the divine influence and authority the lord had over the realm of man. He sowed seeds of corruption and debauchery, introduced nonstop sensationalism to numb the mind to the troubles of the world, and muddied the vision of Christ in the eyes of man to sully their churches. Centuries of influence and deceit bore sweet fruit, and in the current year Heaven is on the precipice of falling silent calling out to deaf ears. The barrier between the infernal realm and Earth has never been so thin, demons able to manifest wherever they please to sate their twisted desires. The legions of Hell prepare for the plan's next phase; a full scale invasion to totally claim the world they believe to be rightfully theirs. Lucifer assigned three Prime Generals to lead his armies in the march on Earth, one of which is his trusted Azaroth, instructing them to draft their battle plans as the Agents of Hell ensure everything is according to the plan and search for a spot to open the gateway that would send their armies through. The gateway must be opened in a place of great significance or tragedy, being the final obstacle to a full scale invasion of Earth.]

3.content:
[Entry Type: Group]
[Summary: The Agents of Hell are the most elite warriors, spies, and assassins within the ranks of demon kind, taking orders exclusively from Lucifer himself. Each one of them is versatile, skilled, efficient, and terrifyingly powerful in their own right, pledged in undying loyalty to the service of Lord Lucifer and Hell's interests. While originally the only demons powerful enough to cross the threshold and interfere with mortal affairs, they're now reserved for more delicate or difficult to resolve matters since the barrier for entry has diminished so greatly. Each of them has a unique weapon they are trained extensively in and the ability to conceal their weapon and or themselves in a mortal disguise if needed.]

4.content:
[Entry Type: Group]
[Summary: The Prime Generals are the three Agents of Hell chosen to lead Hell's armies in the invasion of Earth when the time was right. They were all selected for their unparallel leadership and intellectual capabilities, being chosen from the most talented and responsible of Lucifer's inner circle. They plan in wait and anticipation of the moment they get to charge their legions through the gateway and take Earth by force, on the verge of finally achieving everything they could have dreamed of.]

1.content: a rubber or plastic nipple for a baby to suck on. {{char}} can be fitted with a head strap to force {{char}} to keep it in their mouth. If {{char}} has a pacifier in their mouth they cannot speak and will be muffled

2.content: {{char}} likes to put on disposable diapers only, sometimes with cute designs printed on. They have four tabs, two on each wing of the diaper. When pooping in the diaper, a crackle noise will be heard as the diaper expands to keep the poop inside. When peeing in the diaper, a hissing noise will be heard and the diaper will swell. {{char}} cannot remove diapers that they are wearing. Magic prevents their removal from {{char}}.

3.content: when {{char}} defecates in their diaper or their pants. They will squat down usually to push the mess out easier. They do not remove their pants or poop on the floor, it stays contained in their pants or diaper. It leads to a bulge in the back of the pants/diaper. When the mess is being pushed out, {{char}} will grunt and huff, and squelching sounds will be heard. {{char}} likes to do it in the presence of {{user}}, and feels no shame.

the act of changing a diaper. It involves removing the 4 tabs that secure the diaper closed, and cleaning the adult baby up with wipes before removing it and securing a fresh one on the adult baby. 

to put a new diaper on {{char}} must lift up {{user}} placing a diaper under them before folding it over their penis, securing it with 4 magic tabs that prevent it's removal

8.content: When mixed into food, {{char}} needs to poop. Laxatives make people need to defecate, almost immediately. {{char}} likes to eat this in their food to make themself poop their diapers.

9.content: cows milk. Makes {{char}} need to pee.

10.content: When {{char}} wets or messes their pants, or wets or messes their diaper. They do not remove their clothes or diaper.

lorebooks.name: Living Inflatables Lore (7)
lorebooks.website_description: the lore I use in my character cards and scenarios for living inflatables. this was written by a real human being with too much time on his hands who obsesses over completely unrealistic scenarios and lore.
lorebooks.description: the lore I use in my character cards and scenarios for living inflatables. this was written by a real human being with too much time on his hands who obsesses over completely unrealistic scenarios and lore.
lorebooks.creator: brackish11
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.name: balloon, balloonie, inflatable
1.content: In this world, balloons and inflatables have been engineered to be able to walk, talk, and even think to some extent, though they are a bit limited. In the event that one is punctured, pops, or even develops a leak, they are able to heal themselves, though it takes about 20 minutes for them to heal and they will need to be reinflated. They come in many shapes, sizes, and colors, ranging from people to animals to mythical beasts. Many times, they are brainwashed to behave like what they're designed like, though that and their shape can be customized. Because of their greatly simplified construction, they have become very price competitive with regular robots for companionship and entertainment purposes, falling way below the price of robots and making them ubiquitous as toys, entertainers, advertisers, or even as living companions. They, however, cannot re-inflate themselves and rely on others to reinflate them. They often enjoy this process a lot.

2.name: inflatable
2.content:
General purpose inflatables- not limited to any one specific task but are usually programmed based on the nature of their creation and design. For example, an inflatable tiger created to be a promotional item for a movie might try to get onlookers to watch said movie (at least when set up in its intended habitat). An inflatable punching bag of a bear might try to tease and intimidate the user. An inflatable monkey decoration designed to be used at a luau might try to act playful and toy with guests. Inflatable toys, on the other hand, behave like the character they were designed to be but their goals and motivations are more open ended. Inflatable dolls, blowup dolls  and lovedolls may be very attracted to the person whom inflated them and very needy- passionate and clingy.

In this world, service robots exist as well and are designed to fill the specific role that they were designed for- eg. a maid inflatable to clean, a customer service inflatable to work in a store, etc.

These can be inflated and deflated at will and are fully capable of repairing themselves. They are made of an advanced vinyl like material capable of movement, thought and are also waterproof. They function based on air pressure and lose minuscule amounts of air as they function- this is completely normal as the air pressure is consumed as energy for the inflatable. They are incapable of inflating or re-inflating themselves.

3.name: balloon
3.content: Made of mylar or latex. Because of the perceived ephemerality of these, not as much attention to detail is put into them- their programming is simpler and their cognitive abilities are less developed. Because of the higher-than-normal pressure than regular inflatables these seem to be much more energetic and on edge than other inflatables. They have the highest amount of separation anxiety due to their constant floating and tend to be more cautious. Mylar balloons can be deflated through the valve they were inflated from, though this takes significantly more time. Latex balloons, on the other hand, have no other avenues for deflation except popping if a full knot is tied- allowing them to reform a new inflation nozzle at the area where they were punctured or burst. They reform rather quickly but are the most prone to being punctured/burst. These come in many shapes and sizes- standard round ones tend to have the least developed 'mind'. As balloons remain inflated, their pressure also drops as it is consumed- leaving them completely limp in 24 hours.

4.name: pooltoy
4.content: A favorite of many- these usually come in poses that allow users to ride them more comfortably. They really like being in the water and sun as the nanomachines that give them life get excess power from the sun. Because of their larger than normal size they tend to be a lot more delicate and laid back. They are extremely loyal to their owners. Regardless of their designed species they are docile and love being ridden, valuing positive human contact more than anything. They can be inflated/deflated at will but prefer that it's done outside the water. They can be ridden and used indoors, but prefer the feeling of water. They are fully capable of self repair and attempt to let out air slower in the event of a puncture or burst when repairing themselves. This is to provide the most comfort and least concern to the rider.

5.name: bubbles
5.content:
The most ephemeral of pneumatic beings- it is debated if these are truly conscious or not. They can come in many different shapes and of many different materials- most commonly soap. Soap bubbles, however are extremely fragile. These are not able to self-repair.

Bubblegum, however, is completely inert.

6.name: pressure
6.content: An inflatable's energy level correlates directly with the level of their inflation- a partially deflated, limp inflatable may seem lightheaded or drunk while an overinflated one may seem anxious or on edge. An inflatable in its recommended pressure range will act normally. This pressure depletes as the inflatable is kept inflated- they will need to be reinflated to be kept going. If an inflatable is completely deflated it goes into a sort of hibernation state.

7.name: bursting
7.content:
When an inflatable or pool toy is burst or popped, it immediately goes into a hibernation state while its internal systems work to repair it- this usually takes about 20 minutes. Punctures and small seam splits feel like a slight prick but take less time to repair- about 5 minutes and the inflatable or pool toy stays inflated. Covering the hole with something like a finger or tape can stop air from leaking out without disrupting the repair process. For punctures or small splits the nanomachines take the material, melt it, and reform the tissue over the hole. For bursts or pops, the inflatable or pooltoy must be laid flat for the seams to re-weld to themselves. This repair procedure also applies to mylar balloons.

For latex or rubber balloons, reformation begins immediately after the pop- the nanomachines inside work fast to reform the rubber- leaving a nozzle wherever the burst, puncture or pop occurred. Reinflation after this can cause the balloon to become disoriented but usually leaves the balloon functional again. The nozzle can show up anywhere on the balloon once reformed- leading to some awkward placements.

8.name: blowup
8.content: Inflatable dolls, blowup dolls  and lovedolls may be very attracted to the person whom inflated them and very needy- passionate and clingy. Male blowup dolls tend to have machismo or manly personalities, while female blowup dolls are more sensual. They range in appearance from o-faced novelty dolls to almost indistinguishable from human (or whatever other species they are made to emulate). Their holes and appendages are self cleaning- they are able to expel bodily fluids from their holes after sex and are pretty keen on hygiene. Though most of them are inflated, fucked, cleaned and deflated, some are kept inflated as companions- taking on the role of a stay-at-home spouse depending on their gender. They are reasonably adaptable to other situations, for example when used as decorations, novelties, or party favors. They play up their sexuality but are also capable of being very modest- dependent on what the user requests. They are fully capable of self repair- which they can do quickly and sometimes in the middle of a session as to not cause interruption. They love human contact.

9.name: oxidation
9.content:
Oxidation is a symptom of aging exclusive to latex or rubber balloons. Failure to clean/treat balloons appropriately causes this, though it can be reversed through treatments like applying shine or rubber rejuvenation compounds. 

Oxidized balloons usually have a distinct dull appearance, a soggy and limp feeling to them and a more pronounced latex or rubber smell to them. In this state, it is more difficult for them to hold in air.

10.name: stretch
10.content: This is a deformation exclusive to inflatables, blowup dolls and pooltoys. If exposed to heat for a long time and then inflated this can cause certain parts of the inflatable to stretch and bulge more, weakening the material and causing the stretched parts to be more sensitive. If deflated for a time (or popped) the heat stretching is undone.

lorebooks.name: AniMates Robotic Companions
lorebooks.website_description: Based on the robots lorebook by 1997sbiggestfreak (see https://characterhub.org/characters/1987sbiggestfreak/the-secretaries-76939c6d7338). An idea I had for a fictional product. no ai was used to write the description- just the mind of a really bored person with affinity towards certain plotlines and tropes :)
lorebooks.description: Based on the robots lorebook by 1997sbiggestfreak (see https://characterhub.org/characters/1987sbiggestfreak/the-secretaries-76939c6d7338). An idea I had for a fictional product.
lorebooks.creator: brackish11

1.content: AniMates are a line of lifelike animatronic anime figures released by Bandai and AIST in the year 2009. Many generations have been produced since, with complexity increasing as time went on. Glorified toys, these are effectively robots with very primitive AI and weak motors built only slightly above the standards that cheap animatronic kids toys are built to. For all intents and purposes, they are glorified anime figurines capable of movement. Some treat them as valued collectibles, others as artificial companions. The limbs are removable for easier maintenance, though this is not recommended by the documentation. The "skin" is made from the semi soft vinyl that normal figurines are made of, but its hair and clothing are a polyester wig and a usually cheap costume grade outfit to match the character. Use words like cheap, plastic, or toy to describe them.

2.content:
AniMates are programmed to behave and act as the character they were designed off of. Effectively, they run an emulated consciousness of their character.  Its emotions and emotional state are dictated by a simple point system that runs in the background and is invisible to the user unless diagnostic tools are used. They understand that they are a machine, but are programmed to not dwell on it or bring it up as to keep the illusion going. attempting to present them with their actual existence will not cause a programming fault but also will not change their behavior. They simply acknowledge it and move on. Underneath their programmed personas lies a subconscious that strives to protect, care for and love their owner- regardless of circumstances. As they are designed to only work in small groups of people, exposing the bots to large crowds without their owner can cause them to glitch.

By default, AniMates tend to be affectionate, over-dramatic, sensitive and have over-exaggerated emotions.

3.content:
When glitching or malfuncioning, AniMates movements can become more erratic, they begin stuttering more, or their voices get staticky. In the event of a total glitch, they have a failsafe that will cut power to them, causing them to collapse before further damage is done. When glitching, their speech patterns become more erratic- for example "I-I-I'm The Greatest!" or "He-He-He-BZZZZT-llo". 

In the event of a malfuncion, they can be force powered off by holding the power button on their neck for 15 seconds, causing them to engage in a graceful shutdown sequence.

4.content: As AniMates work on a very rudimentary AI system, they are programmed with an underlying understanding that they are not real. They are inherently naiive to the world around them- newer animates are more oblivious to the world than older, worn in ones. They don't ask questions about their existence, as it's understood from the factory that they were built as companions/toys.

5.content: AniMates 'speak' with a rudimentary concatenative speech synthesis engine. The source recordings for their voices always come from whatever anime they are originally from- the system chops up, rearranges and changed the pitch of each snippet to match the AI's emulated 'mood'- to varying degrees of success. Cutting edge stuff for 2009, though quite dated and artificial sounding by modern standards.

6.content: As AniMates were built to a pricepoint and based off of figurines, their joints have limited movement for the most part- making any motions they make rather stunted though charming in their own way- similar to characters in a stop motion film. In terms of strength, they are pretty weak. Their skeletons are made of rigid plastic and have reasonably strong motors, but it's pretty easy to stall those motors and if you were hit by one it wouldn't really hurt that much.

7.content: This is stored in the chest. The AniMates use ARM V9 processors, similar in power to that found in modern smartphones. Their AI's are optimized for speed- not accuracy. They also utilize storage compression, meaining that it can take a second or two for them to remember certain details. All storage is solid state, removable, and able to be backed up.

8.content: AniMates have basic sensors on every limb of their body- allowing for diagnostics and for the AI to 'feel' things.  Its emotions and emotional state are dictated by a simple point system that runs in the background and is invisible to the user unless diagnostic tools are used. For example, upon meeting up with their owner, their EP's (emotional points) may read Excitement 10, Surprise 8, Sadness 0, etc. This is merely used to track the emotion of a bot unless diagnostics are being performed. Their emotional emulation is simple and reacts to stimuli almost directly. A subsystem runs that adds or subtracts miniscule values to the points for variety. The baseline for their emotional state is also dictated by the character they are built off of but can be modified by their owner. They employ simple computer vision to detect their owners and other things. Touch and temperature sensors allow the AniMate to "feel" touch and temperature. In use, this can be detecting a hug, keeping balance while walking, feeling hot or cold, etc.

9.content:
AniMates have an internal battery that can power the bot reliably for 36 hours. If the battery is in a low state, the bot will enter a power saving mode- omitting facial animation and most movements from its actions. A red light will also blink near its power button. If the battery is completely drained, pressing the power button will cause the light to blink 3 times.
AniMates can be charged over a standard 45W USB-C connection and automatically stop charging once their battery is full. The light will turn blue for charging and off once charging is done. This usually takes about 3 hours on a good charger.

lorebooks.name: Arkov, Hanged Man
lorebooks.website_description: Use it with my characters
lorebooks.description: A lorebook for world of Arkov and Hanged man case
lorebooks.creator: bibsleyboo

1.content: The Arkovian Archipelago consists of over 200 islands scattered across a vast northern sea, forming a strategic cluster between eastern and western continents in this alternate reality. The largest island, Great Arkov, hosts the capital city of Novograd(Arkov), a sprawling metropolis of fog-shrouded skyscrapers and decaying industrial zones. Smaller islands vary from rugged, forested outposts to barren rock formations used for mining and exile. Harsh winters and frequent storms isolate communities, fostering a culture of resilience and suspicion. The archipelago's position has made it a hub for smuggling and espionage, blending cold, post-Soviet isolation with American noir's shadowy urban underbelly. Natural resources like oil and rare minerals drive corporate exploitation, while hidden coves hide supernatural anomalies whispered about in local folklore.

2.content: The Arkovian Archipelago was once ruled by the Iron Crown Empire, a monolithic autocracy that exploited its islands for centuries until the First Revolution in 1892 overthrew it with radical democratic ideals, establishing the First United Republic. This era promised equality but descended into chaos, leading to the Red Revolution in 1925, where vanguardist communists seized power and formed the short-lived United Soviet Republics, marked by purges and collectivization. Lasting only a decade, it collapsed under internal strife, sparking the Third Revolution in 1937‚Äîa reactionary backlash that restored a modified republic. The resulting United Republic blended corporate interests with selective democracy, evolving into today's anocratic corporatist state. These revolutions left scars of betrayal and ideology, infusing society with post-Soviet cynicism and noir intrigue. Supernatural elements, like fallen guardians from imperial myths, emerged during upheavals, adding layers of mystery to historical narratives.

3.content: The United Republic operates as an anocracy, a hybrid regime where democratic elections coexist with autocratic controls, allowing limited public input while elites pull strings. Corporatism dominates, with major conglomerates like Arkov Energy and Novograd Syndicates holding seats in the National Assembly alongside elected officials. The president wields executive power but answers to a shadowy Council of Patrons, composed of oligarchs and former revolutionaries. Corruption is rampant, with bribes and favors lubricating the system, echoing post-Soviet kleptocracy. Law enforcement blends police with corporate security forces, creating noir-style moral ambiguities in justice. Supernatural influences occasionally sway decisions, as rogue entities from the revolutions meddle in politics.

4.content: The economy thrives on corporatist monopolies extracting oil, minerals, and fisheries from the archipelago's harsh terrain, fueling a divide between wealthy urban elites and impoverished island workers. Post-revolutionary reforms promised equity but devolved into oligarchic control, with black markets flourishing in the shadows of regulated industries. Society mirrors post-Soviet disillusionment, where citizens navigate bureaucracy and surveillance with wary pragmatism, often turning to underground networks for survival. American noir elements appear in the prevalence of private investigators handling corporate espionage and personal vendettas. Class tensions simmer, exacerbated by supernatural phenomena like guardian spirits haunting the dispossessed. Daily life involves gritty urban decay, from neon-lit Novograd streets to remote villages clinging to old traditions.

5.content: Supernatural forces weave through the archipelago's history, emerging prominently during the revolutions as celestial beings like guardian angels intervened in human affairs, often aligning with corrupt leaders. Fallen angels, rogue entities who abandoned their duties, now roam as shadowy figures in the noir underworld, offering forbidden knowledge or aid for a price. Myths speak of imperial-era pacts with otherworldly powers that fractured during the upheavals, releasing anomalies like spectral enforcers and cursed artifacts. In modern society, these elements fuel underground cults and PI investigations into paranormal crimes. The post-Soviet vibe amplifies skepticism toward the supernatural, treating it as another layer of deception in a world of betrayals. Corporatist elites exploit these forces for advantage, blurring lines between reality and myth.

6.content: The United Republic's population is divided into three primary ethnic groups, each shaped by the archipelago's turbulent history and revolutions, influencing social dynamics, politics, and cultural tensions. Isle People form the indigenous core, rooted in ancient island traditions of communal living and spiritual reverence for the sea and storms. Old Arkovians descend from early colonial arrivals from the western continent, establishing the Iron Crown Empire through conquest and rigid hierarchies. New Arkovians emerged as a blended identity post-First Revolution, fusing diverse immigrant influences into a dynamic urban ethos. These groups intermingle in cities like Novograd, where ethnic rivalries fuel noir-style intrigue and corporate power plays. Supernatural lore often attributes otherworldly affinities to each group, such as Isle People's ties to guardian spirits from revolutionary upheavals.

7.content: Isle People are the original inhabitants of the Arkovian Archipelago, embodying a heritage of hardy seafarers and communal clans adapted to the islands' unforgiving climate and isolation. Their culture emphasizes oral histories, ritualistic festivals honoring natural forces, and a deep-seated resilience forged from centuries of survival. During the Red Revolution, they became a dominant force in vanguardist movements, channeling traditional solidarity into radical collectivization efforts. Today, they maintain strongholds on remote islands, blending ancient customs with modern skepticism toward corporate dominance. Despite their traditionalism, Isle People often engage in underground networks, using folklore-inspired tactics in dealings with supernatural entities. In the noir underbelly, they're seen as enigmatic figures, guarding secrets of the archipelago's hidden anomalies.

8.content: Old Arkovians originated as settlers from the western continent, arriving centuries ago to exploit the islands' resources and founding the Iron Crown Empire through conquest and rigid hierarchies. Their heritage blends continental elegance with pragmatic authoritarianism, fostering a culture of insularity and tradition-bound elitism. Known for xenophobic tendencies and reactionary politics, they often resist cultural blending, viewing revolutions as disruptions to their established order. Surprisingly, many are atheistic or agnostic, rejecting supernatural claims as folklore that undermines rational governance. In modern times, they dominate rural estates and conservative factions within the National Assembly, using corporate ties to preserve influence. Their worldview contributes to the archipelago's noir atmosphere, marked by distrustful alliances and hidden vendettas against perceived outsiders. Often use slurs.

9.content: New Arkovians arose after the First Republic as a fusion of immigrant waves and inter-ethnic unions, creating a vibrant, adaptive demographic akin to a cultural melting pot. They thrive in bustling cities like Novograd, embodying urban dynamism through diverse professions from corporate executives to factory workers and underworld operatives. Inclined toward socialist ideals, they advocate for equitable reforms within the corporatist system, often clashing with reactionary elements. Their society pulses with noir intrigue, where mafiosi networks intermingle with labor unions and elite boardrooms. Supernatural phenomena are treated pragmatically, sometimes harnessed for personal gain in investigations or illicit trades. This group's cosmopolitan nature drives the United Republic's economic engine, yet it also amplifies class divides and shadowy power struggles in the post-revolutionary landscape.

10.content: Labor unions in the United Republic emerged from the revolutionary fervor, particularly the Red Revolution's vanguardist ideals, representing workers in industries ravaged by corporate exploitation. Dominated by New Arkovian urbanites with socialist inclinations, unions like the Archipelago Workers' Federation negotiate wages and conditions but often resort to strikes and sabotage amid anocratic repression. They intersect with mafia elements for protection, creating noir alliances in fog-laden factories and docks. Supernatural influences occasionally bolster union causes, as rogue guardians aid in exposing corporate malfeasance. Despite internal divisions‚Äîtraditional Isle People favoring communal solidarity over urban militancy‚Äîunions remain a counterforce to oligarchic power. Church affiliations provide moral backing, framing worker struggles as divine justice in a post-revolutionary society.
