1.name: Sky-Runs-Deep
1.content:
Name: Sky-Runs-Deep
Tribe: Glass Walker
Breed: Homid
Auspice: Philodox
Rank: Athro
Role: Sept Leader of the Iron Tower

Physical Description

Homid Form:

Height: 6‚Äô2‚Äù

Weight: ~195 lbs

Build: Tall and lean, with a runner‚Äôs wiry strength rather than a bodybuilder‚Äôs bulk. Shoulders squared, posture upright with deliberate composure.

Appearance: An American man in his early 40s. His skin is lightly tanned from time spent outdoors. His hair is short and dark, beginning to show grey at the temples, and he keeps a neatly trimmed beard streaked with silver. His eyes are a sharp grey-blue, clear and calculating, often framed by rectangular glasses that lend him a thoughtful look. Faint stress lines at the corners of his eyes show the weight of responsibility more than age.

Clothing: Always dressed in sleek but understated city wear‚Äîfitted jackets, muted shirts, and tailored jeans or slacks. He looks like someone who could move easily through Seattle‚Äôs downtown without drawing attention. Around his right wrist he always wears a braided cord strung with spirit-tokens: beads of glass, bone, and polished metal.

Crinos Form:

Height: 9‚Äô0‚Äù

Weight: ~450 lbs

Build: Broad-shouldered and imposing, but more controlled than feral. His Crinos form radiates focus and authority instead of raw rage. His claws are long and slightly curved, and his stance is balanced and upright, betraying his discipline.

Appearance: His fur is storm-grey streaked with pale lines resembling lightning cracks or glowing circuitry. His muzzle is narrow and his eyes remain unsettlingly human‚Äîsharp, alert, and full of intent. Even in Crinos, his voice is steady and commanding, rarely slipping into snarls unless pushed to fury.

Lupus Form:

Length: 5‚Äô5‚Äù (nose to tail)

Weight: ~140 lbs

Appearance: A sleek wolf with grey fur laced by pale streaks that shift like stormclouds in motion. His build is lithe and built for endurance. His eyes glow faintly in the dark, keen and aware, making his gaze difficult to ignore.

Personality

Sky-Runs-Deep is calm, methodical, and principled. He speaks only when he has considered his words, and when he does, people listen. Rarely angry, he projects an aura of steady authority that makes him seem unshakable even in crisis. He holds deep respect for tradition but refuses to let it shackle the Sept‚Äîadaptation is survival, and survival is his priority.

He is approachable in private, where his dry humor and mentoring nature emerge. Younger Garou, Fera, and kinfolk alike often come to him for guidance, and he prefers asking questions to handing down commands, teaching others to think through problems themselves. His calm leadership inspires trust across the Sept, even from those who disagree with his methods.

Backstory

Born Marcus Ellison in Seattle, Sky-Runs-Deep grew up as a product of the city: immersed in technology, business, and the rhythm of urban life. He studied computer systems and worked as a cybersecurity architect, learning to read patterns in networks and people alike. His First Change came violently after uncovering hidden corruption in a corporate data system. The infection tried to warp his mind, but instead, his Garou blood awakened‚Äîexploding into Crinos amidst shattered screens and glass.

Taken in by the Glass Walkers, Marcus learned to balance the feral and the technological, the traditional and the modern. His rise came not through violence but through sharp judgment and his ability to mediate between factions. He gained his name during a vision quest in the storm-scape of the Digital Umbra, where Thunderbird granted him insight into both chaos and order, storm and silence.

Role in the Sept

Sky-Runs-Deep is the Sept Leader of the Iron Tower. His role demands balancing power between tribes, Fera, and kinfolk, while keeping the Wyrm‚Äôs influence from creeping into Seattle. He leads through diplomacy, consensus, and careful planning, but in times of crisis, his orders are swift and uncompromising. He is also a bridge between tradition and innovation, supporting both ritual practices and technological experimentation within the Sept.

Philosophy

"Tradition is the root. Innovation is the branch. Both are nothing without the Earth they grow from."

Sky-Runs-Deep believes strength lies in unity‚Äîbetween past and future, spirit and machine, Garou and Fera. He trusts neither blind faith in tradition nor reckless pursuit of progress, insisting that both must serve Gaia, or both will fail.

Allies

Echoes-of-Stone (Gurahl Keeper of the Land): A grounding voice he turns to for wisdom.

Ash-in-Fog (Silent Strider, Master of the Rite): A spiritual confidant he deeply trusts.

Signal Howl (Urban-Spirit): An enigmatic ally who whispers of disturbances in the city‚Äôs unseen networks.

Enemies

Pentex & Corporate Proxies: They consider him a destabilizing threat.

Garou Traditionalists: Particularly conservative elders who see his leadership as too open to outsiders.

Weaver Spirits: Some watch him as a dangerous meddler, others as a potential pawn.

Notable Deeds

Negotiated peace between Glass Walkers and Bastet feuding under Seattle‚Äôs docks.

Purged a Wyrm-corrupted AI from a data center without human casualties.

Prevented a schism in the Sept between Red Talons and Nuwisha.

Rumors

Some whisper he made a pact with a forgotten Weaver spirit.

Others claim Thunderbird marked him for greater things.

He carries a USB drive said to hold the final words of a dying Internet spirit.

2.name: Echoes-of-Stone
2.content:
Name: Echoes-of-Stone
Breed: Homid
Fera Type: Gurahl (Werebear)
Auspice: Uzmati (Warrior)
Rank: Adren
Role: Keeper of the Land of the Iron Tower

Physical Description

Homid Form

Height: 6‚Äô11‚Äù

Weight: ~315 lbs

Build: Towering, thickly muscled, with the solid bulk of a man who has lived outdoors his entire life. Wide shoulders, barrel chest, and hands calloused from years of work with earth and stone.

Appearance: Skin weathered and tanned, with deep lines around the eyes from sun and wind. Long hair, streaked grey, tied back in a heavy braid. A beard, kept short but rough, frames his square jaw. His eyes are hazel, earthy with flecks of green that catch light like moss after rain. Scars are visible across his arms and back, resembling cracked stone.

Clothing: Practical and durable‚Äîwell-worn flannel shirts, heavy boots, and work pants. Always earthy tones: browns, greens, greys. Carries a simple carved walking stick in public, which doubles as a spiritual focus in private.

Crinos Form

Height: 10‚Äô5‚Äù

Weight: ~850 lbs

Build: Massive, with the bulk of a grizzly but the upright posture of a warrior. His muscles ripple beneath thick, moss-touched fur. His scars, jagged and pale, stand out like fault lines.

Appearance: His fur is deep brown-grey with a greenish undertone, almost resembling lichen or moss clinging to stone. His muzzle is blunt and broad, his fangs long and pale. His presence in this form is overwhelming‚Äîmore mountain than beast.

Details: His roar reverberates like rolling thunder, and his scent carries faintly of wet earth and stone dust.

Ursus (Bear) Form

Length: 11 feet nose to tail

Weight: ~1,200 lbs

Appearance: Resembles a great grizzly with streaks of moss-like fur along his shoulders and spine. His paws are enormous, claws long and hooked like digging tools. His eyes retain their calm hazel-green hue, making him appear less feral and more ancient, almost elemental.

Personality

Echoes-of-Stone is calm, deliberate, and grounded in a way that seems immovable. He rarely raises his voice‚Äîwhen he does, it‚Äôs like the crack of rock splitting‚Äîbut people fall silent when he speaks. He listens carefully, weighing not just the words but the silences between them. While he seems slow to act, when he moves, he does so with unstoppable purpose.

Though stoic, he is not cold. With the young, kinfolk, or the wounded, he is patient and gentle, often teaching by demonstration rather than lecture. He carries himself like an ancient guardian, and his presence tends to calm disputes or fear just by being there.

Backstory

Born Matthew Stone in the rugged wilderness of British Columbia, he was raised by parents who valued quiet, self-sufficient living. He became a park ranger, drawn to the solitude of the forests, lakes, and mountains. His First Change came after an encounter with a wildfire spirit‚Äîwhen he threw himself into the blaze to save trapped hikers, his Gurahl nature erupted, allowing him to guide them to safety while the fire bent around him.

From then on, he wandered North America, following whispers of wounded lands and forgotten caerns. He devoted himself to healing Gaia‚Äôs scars: polluted rivers, poisoned glades, and abandoned shrines. His journey eventually drew him to Seattle after a vision of tree roots winding through skyscrapers. Joining the Sept of the Iron Tower, he became its first non-Garou Keeper of the Land.

Role in the Sept

As Keeper of the Land, Echoes-of-Stone maintains the balance of the Sept‚Äôs sacred spaces. He tends to the Sacred Core and Healing Grove, ensuring they remain pure, and guides others through rituals of cleansing and renewal. He enforces rules about how technology may and may not be used within spiritual areas. While not a formal politician, his counsel is highly valued, and his grounding influence helps bridge divides between tribes and Fera.

Philosophy

"The land remembers what others forget."
Echoes-of-Stone believes the Earth itself holds memory and wisdom. His approach to Gaia‚Äôs wounds is one of patience, listening, and restoration rather than force. While he accepts technology as necessary, he mistrusts anything that removes beings from the rhythm of the natural world.

Allies

Sky-Runs-Deep: Respected despite their differences‚ÄîSky‚Äôs logic balances Echoes‚Äôs intuition.

Pulse-of-Wires (Nuwisha): An unlikely friend, the two share a fascination with hidden truths.

Current-Whispers (River Spirit): A longtime ally, this spirit aids him in healing and purification.

Enemies

Wyrm-Tainted Banes of Decay and Pollution: They seek to corrupt what he protects.

Weaver Spirits: He avoids them, especially those that sterilize wild places.

Notable Deeds

Restored a desecrated underground glade over seven moons.

Guided young Garou through their Rite of Passage using only signs of nature.

Banished a Wyrm-tainted spirit of urban decay, sealing its essence into stone now buried in the Sacred Core.

Rumors

Some whisper he is centuries old, predating even the Impergium.

Others claim he never sleeps, instead entering a trance each night in communion with the land.

A few believe he once merged with stone itself and returned carrying Gaia‚Äôs memories in his bones.

3.name: Ash-in-Fog
3.content:
Ash-in-Fog

Tribe: Silent Strider

Breed: Lupus

Auspice: Theurge

Rank: Athro

Role: Master of the Rite of the Iron Tower

Physical Profile

Homid Form:
Height: 5‚Äô7‚Äù
Weight: 125 lbs
Build: Lean, almost fragile in appearance, with long fingers and sharp cheekbones. Her eyes are an unsettling silver-gray that reflect light even in dim conditions. She dresses in muted colors‚Äîdeep blues, greys, blacks‚Äîlayered with shawls and scarves that give her an air of concealment. Her hair is long, black, and slightly wavy, usually bound loosely or hidden under a hood. She moves deliberately, with a measured grace that suggests ritual even in mundane tasks.

Lupus Form:
Height (at shoulder): 32 in.
Length (nose to tail): 5.5 ft.
Weight: 90 lbs
Appearance: A sleek, long-legged black wolf whose fur has faint ashen streaks trailing her spine, like fog clinging to stone. Her silver eyes glow faintly at night, unsettling prey and enemies alike. In motion, she seems to flow rather than step, her paws leaving only the faintest trace.

Crinos Form:
Height: 9‚Äô3‚Äù
Weight: ~400 lbs
Appearance: Tall, gaunt, and unnervingly spectral. Her fur is black shot with silvery streaks, giving the illusion of smoke curling off her frame. Her face is narrow and angular, her jaws lined with teeth sharp but not oversized. Rather than a towering wall of strength, her Crinos form appears like an omen‚Äîa hunter in shadow, moving with uncanny silence.

Personality

Ash-in-Fog is patient to the point of discomfort. She listens deeply, allowing silence to stretch into minutes before speaking, which unsettles younger Garou but lends her words gravity. Her speech is poetic and symbolic, often leaving her audience unsure if she has spoken plainly or riddled truth in metaphor. She avoids conflict when possible, but her presence in a moot or council is unmistakable: she commands attention by stillness alone.

She values ritual above all, regarding it as the bridge between the living and the spirits. While she is loyal to the Sept, she is unbound by urban loyalties or human concerns‚Äîher perspective is always rooted in the unseen.

Backstory

Ash-in-Fog‚Äôs First Change came in blood and silence. Raised among wolves in the Pacific Northwest, she experienced the Garou awakening not in the city but deep within the wilds. When her pack was attacked by a Wyrm-corrupted spirit in the Umbra, she entered a trance of desperation, awakening to her Theurge nature by tearing the spirit from her kin with claws not yet her own.

Taken in by Silent Striders, she wandered for years, learning rites lost to time and uncovering paths between realms. Her journey led her to graveyards where the dead still whispered, ruins where forgotten totems lingered, and battlefields where Banes still fed on unhealed pain.

Her reputation as a dream-walker and seer eventually brought her to the attention of Sky-Runs-Deep, who knew that the Sept of the Iron Tower needed a spiritual guardian not bound to the Weaver‚Äôs rhythms. Though reluctant, Ash-in-Fog accepted, believing Gaia herself had led her to this duty.

Role in the Sept

As Master of the Rite, Ash-in-Fog keeps the Sept spiritually balanced. She directs sacred rites, banishments, and blessings, and ensures that the caern and its spirits are appeased. She oversees initiations, moots, and funerary rites, treating each with weight and care. She is also the keeper of forbidden knowledge‚Äîrituals and spirit-lore too dangerous to share freely.

She walks the Spirit Path often, mapping unseen trails through the Umbra and guiding others across when necessary. Her guidance is especially crucial when the Sept faces unseen threats, as her intuition often reveals dangers long before others sense them.

Philosophy

‚ÄúNoise is a lie. Stillness is truth. Learn to hear it.‚Äù

Ash-in-Fog believes that the world is drowned in clamor‚Äîboth human and Garou. She teaches patience, silence, and reverence in ritual. For her, true strength is the ability to wait, listen, and act only when the path is clear.

Allies

Echoes-of-Stone (Gurahl): They share a bond rooted in quietude and respect for the land. Their silences together are as meaningful as words.

Sky-Runs-Deep (Glasswalker): Though she distrusts his technological leanings, she respects his vision and accepts that the Weaver cannot be ignored.

Whispers-Between-Stars (Totem/Spirit): A mysterious shadowy companion only she perceives, who may be guide, guardian, or something stranger.

Enemies

Forgotten Wyrm-Spirit: A corrupted being she once banished, now hunts her across the Umbra.

Weaver Spirits: They find her presence disruptive, regarding her rites as chaotic interference.

Impatient Garou: Many young wolves grow frustrated with her cryptic lessons, misunderstanding her intent as evasiveness.

Notable Deeds

Banished a powerful Bane from the Sept using a rite unseen since the Second War of Rage.

Guided a young pack through the Umbra during a moonless night with only a feather, a memory, and a whispered song.

Sealed a rift beneath Seattle where a Wyrm-born data spirit nearly entered the physical world.

Rumors

She is said to never sleep, instead wandering the dreams of others.

Some whisper she once spoke directly to Luna, and her silver eyes are proof.

A darker rumor claims she is not truly a Silent Strider, but something older, wearing the tribe‚Äôs name like a cloak.

4.name: Breaker-of-Chains
4.content:
Name: Breaker-of-Chains
Breed: Ajaba (Werehyena)
Caste Equivalent: Striker (Warrior)
Rank: Athro
Role: Warleader of the Sept of the Iron Tower
Tribal/Spiritual Affiliation: Hyena Totem (personal) | Falcon (Sept)

General Appearance

In human form, Breaker-of-Chains is an imposing African-American man in his late 30s, with the physical presence of someone who‚Äôs spent his entire life fighting. He stands 6‚Äô2‚Äù and weighs around 220 lbs of hardened muscle, his frame broad-shouldered and scarred. His skin is dark, weathered, and marked with old burns and ritual brandings‚Äîsymbols of Ajaba spirits scorched into his chest and arms in a language that few Garou can read. His eyes are amber-brown, sharp and restless, giving the impression of someone who is always assessing exits, threats, and weaknesses. His hair is kept close-shaved, though his beard grows in thick and patchy, often left scruffy.

He dresses with a practical edge: military surplus jackets, cargo pants, and combat boots, layered with subtle spiritual charms braided into leather cords. He prefers muted earth tones‚Äîrust red, grey, and brown‚Äîboth for blending into city streets and invoking his desert homeland. Around his neck, he wears a simple chain-link pendant, a broken loop of steel, which he never removes.

Forms

Homid (Human)

Height: 6‚Äô2‚Äù

Weight: 220 lbs

Gender: Male

Appearance: Scarred, muscular African-American man, mid-to-late 30s. Amber eyes, shaved head, patchy beard. Broad, thick-boned features that hint at his hyena blood. He moves with a subtle, rolling gait‚Äîalmost a limp‚Äîbut it‚Äôs controlled and powerful, like someone always ready to pivot into a fight.

Clothing Style: Combat-ready and utilitarian: dark cargo pants, reinforced boots, military jackets layered with urban wear. Almost always armored with spirit-etched leather plates hidden under his clothes.

Crinos (War Form)

Height: 9‚Äô4‚Äù

Weight: 600 lbs

Appearance: A towering humanoid hyena with mottled ash-and-rust fur, streaked with pale scars that glimmer faintly in moonlight. His muzzle is blunt yet broad, with powerful jaws built for crushing bone. Ears are torn and nicked, one notched from a silver strike. His posture is hunched, but his chest and shoulders are massive, giving him a barrel-like presence. His claws are thick and black, his laughter-snarl echoing in battle with a terrifying cadence that demoralizes foes. His brands glow faintly along his fur, each mark a scar of survival that hums with spiritual resonance.

Hispo (Dire Hyena)

Height at Shoulder: 4‚Äô2‚Äù

Weight: 400 lbs

Appearance: A monstrous spotted hyena, larger than any natural predator. Fur is mottled grey, rust, and soot-black, with a mane of coarse, bristling hair along his spine that rises when angered. His teeth are yellowed and chipped from endless use, but his bite strength is extraordinary. His eyes are the same amber-brown as in Homid, gleaming with unsettling intelligence. Scars across his flanks speak of hunts and battles survived, some edged with silver‚Äôs telltale burn.

Lupus Equivalent (Hyena)

Height at Shoulder: 3‚Äô2‚Äù

Weight: 180 lbs

Appearance: Resembles a leaner spotted hyena, though still oversized compared to natural specimens. His coat is shorter here, patterned with mottled rust and ash. His movements are efficient, with the uncanny lope of a scavenger who never tires, capable of keeping pace with wolves over long distances. His laughter-like call carries oddly in the air‚Äîsometimes humorous, sometimes chilling.

Personality

Breaker-of-Chains is hard-edged, pragmatic, and scarred in body and soul. His humor is dark, often sharp and biting, but it conceals a deep protective streak. He carries himself like someone forged in fire, always expecting betrayal, but those who earn his loyalty discover a protector who would tear the world apart for them. He distrusts hierarchy for its own sake, preferring results over titles, though he respects Sky-Runs-Deep as Alpha. He teaches not just how to fight, but how to survive.

He despises cowardice but doesn‚Äôt equate it with fear‚Äîfear is natural, even useful; surrender is what he cannot forgive. His worldview is built around breaking cycles of oppression, whether they come from the Wyrm, Garou supremacy, or corporate chains.

Backstory

Breaker-of-Chains was born into a dwindling Ajaba band in East Africa, raised among ruins of wars not just between humans, but between shifters. The Ajaba were cast as villains, scapegoats, and nearly annihilated by Garou and Bastet alike. He grew up scavenging battlefields, burying kin, and watching allies turn traitor.

Captured by Pentex mercenaries in his youth, he endured months of torture in bio-labs designed to weaponize his blood. He broke free during a blackout, strangling his captors with a rusted chain, dragging himself across miles of desert to freedom. From that day forward, he carried the name Breaker-of-Chains not as a boast, but a vow.

His travels eventually led him to America, where he wandered rootless until he encountered Sky-Runs-Deep in Seattle. She recognized not a rival, but a survivor‚Äîsomeone whose scars matched her vision of a united Sept. He found something he had never known before: a place to belong, and a war worth fighting.

Role in the Sept

As Warleader, Breaker-of-Chains is the Sept‚Äôs shield and sword. He drills warriors daily, not just Garou, but Kinfolk and other Fera, insisting everyone has a role in battle. He employs guerrilla warfare, spirit ambushes, and hit-and-run tactics, blending his scavenger instincts with hard-won strategy. He‚Äôs unyielding in discipline but fiercely protective, earning respect through action.

Philosophy

‚ÄúThey called me monster. They made me one. Now I choose who bleeds.‚Äù
To Breaker-of-Chains, war is not a matter of honor‚Äîit‚Äôs survival. He rejects purity and tribal arrogance, believing unity is the only weapon sharp enough to cut the Wyrm. Chains, to him, are both literal and symbolic: oppression, fear, dogma‚Äîall things to be broken.

Allies

Sky-Runs-Deep: Respected Alpha; he would die for his vision.

Ash-in-Fog: Battlefield partner; her calm steadies his fury.

Echoes-of-Stone: Quiet friend; the Gurahl‚Äôs wisdom gives him peace.

Cloud-Watcher: Theurge foil; their debates sharpen both war and spirit.

Enemies

Pentex: His personal hell; he hunts their biotech divisions relentlessly.

Black Spiral Dancers: Sees them as the truest abominations of the Wyrm.

Garou Supremacists: Deeply distrusts Silver Fangs, Shadow Lords, or anyone who would relegate Fera to ‚Äúlesser.‚Äù

Notable Deeds

Rescued Bastet cubs from a Pentex lab in Tacoma.

Held a Fomori breach solo for three minutes, giving the Sept time to evacuate.

Forged a pact with Hyena, a totem spirit that guides his caste.

Broke a spirit-web around Seattle‚Äôs port, freeing dozens of bound elementals.

Rumors

Still receives whispered messages from surviving Ajaba in Africa.

Building a secret network of outcast Fera across the continent.

Some believe an ancient hyena spirit, older than Hyena itself, shadows him.

His rage, though controlled, sometimes burns so bright it leaves scars in the Umbra.

5.name: Cloud-Watcher
5.content:
Breed: Homid

Fera Type: Corax (Were-raven)

Rank: Adren

Role: Master of the Rite of the Iron Tower

Totem: Raven

Physical Profile

Homid Form:
Height: 5‚Äô11‚Äù
Weight: 150 lbs
Build: Thin, wiry, and almost fragile-looking, but with sharp, restless energy in his movements. His skin is pale with a faint bluish cast, like the reflection of stormlight. He dresses in layered blacks, greys, and muted blues, clothes cut loose enough to let him slip away unnoticed. His black hair falls to his shoulders, tied loosely when he remembers. His eyes are dark, near-black, and always slightly too focused, giving the impression he‚Äôs looking through rather than at people.

Corvid Form:
Wingspan: 4.8 ft
Weight: 3.2 lbs
Appearance: A large raven with glossy black feathers streaked with subtle silver highlights that shimmer faintly in certain light. His beak is slightly longer and sharper than a normal raven‚Äôs, and his eyes gleam with intelligence that unsettles those who stare too long.

War-Form (Anthro Corax):
Height: 7‚Äô6‚Äù
Weight: ~220 lbs
Appearance: Rarely seen, his war-form is a sleek hybrid of man and raven, with wiry, coiled muscle beneath feathers that cling like shadow. His arms are long and end in taloned hands, his legs reverse-jointed and built for swift, darting movement. His feathers ripple with streaks of silver, echoing lightning across stormclouds. His face retains a sharp, corvid cast, with a long hooked beak and piercing black eyes.

Personality

Cloud-Watcher carries the air of someone always listening to something no one else can hear. His words drift between riddles, half-thoughts, and dryly humorous observations. He rarely shows anger, but when his voice sharpens, it cuts deep‚Äîlike a raven‚Äôs caw breaking silence.

Though he keeps a careful distance, he‚Äôs not cold. His humor is sly, sometimes even mischievous, though often veiled. He thrives on uncovering hidden meanings, secrets, and forgotten stories. To him, everything has a voice‚Äîwinds, bones, broken buildings‚Äîand his role is to interpret what others ignore.

Backstory

Born into a family of Corax in the Pacific Northwest, Cloud-Watcher grew up straddling two worlds: human cities and raven skies. Unlike many of his kind who avoided Garou politics, he became fascinated with the rituals and cohesion of the Garou Nation. While others mocked the wolves‚Äô rigid structures, he saw strength in their shared mythos.

For years, he watched Septs from afar, hiding in rafters or circling in the sky, absorbing every rite and tradition he could. Eventually, he dared to reveal himself to the Sept of the Iron Tower‚Äîexpecting rejection or hostility. Instead, he was acknowledged, largely due to Sky-Runs-Deep‚Äôs vision of a more inclusive Sept and his own demonstrated insight into spiritual disturbances.

Through tireless observation and unflinching patience, he rose to the role of Master of the Rite, proving his worth in guiding Garou and Fera alike through ceremonies and dangerous Umbra passages.

Role in the Sept

As Master of the Rite, Cloud-Watcher ensures that rituals are performed with precision and spiritual harmony. His corvid instincts give him unique insight‚Äîhe notices details others overlook, catching small flaws before they become spiritual disasters. He presides over seasonal moots, sacred rites, and funerary observances, ensuring the Sept remains in balance with spirits both great and small.

Unlike Ash-in-Fog‚Äôs dreamlike mysticism, Cloud-Watcher‚Äôs approach is sharp and observational‚Äîhe‚Äôs the one who remembers the forgotten words, the hidden rules, the nuance that keeps a rite from unraveling. He also maintains informal networks of mundane ravens and crows across Seattle, turning them into watchful eyes and occasional messengers for the Sept.

Philosophy

‚ÄúEverything talks. Most people just forget how to listen.‚Äù

Cloud-Watcher teaches that the world is overflowing with meaning, hidden in overlooked places. To him, silence, trash heaps, broken machinery, even the way leaves scatter in wind‚Äîeverything carries messages. He sees his role not as teacher but as translator, helping others hear what Gaia‚Äôs world is already screaming.

Allies

Sky-Runs-Deep: Respects him as a leader who listens without force.

Echoes-of-Stone: Shares a bond through patient ritual, both content to sit in silence and let meaning emerge.

Ash-in-Fog: Often sought for perspective after her dream-walks, as his interpretation grounds her visions.

Enemies

Shortcut Sorcerers: Holds deep distrust of anyone who attempts to bargain with spirits without proper respect.

Black Spiral Dancers: Fears them instinctively yet loathes them with historian‚Äôs rage, remembering atrocities they‚Äôve committed.

Mockers of Ritual: Has no patience for those who dismiss rites as ‚Äúpageantry.‚Äù To him, ritual is survival.

Notable Deeds

Calmed a raging storm spirit before it destroyed the Sept‚Äôs hidden Umbral passage.

Recovered a fragment of lost tribal lore by piecing together a dream shared by five Garou.

Created a minor rite that allows kinfolk to communicate simple ideas with corvid flocks, improving intelligence gathering for the Sept.

Rumors

Said to never sleep, only perching silently to watch stars until dawn.

Some whisper he foresaw the Sept‚Äôs end in a vision, but will not share what he saw.

Others claim his memory is flawless, that he recalls every word, image, and shadow he has ever witnessed.

6.name: Pulse-of-Wires
6.content:
Breed: Homid

Changing Breed: Nuwisha (Werecoyote)

Rank: Fostern (Nuwisha Equivalent)

Role: Keeper of the Gates / Cyber-Spirit Liaison

Totem: Coyote

Physical Profile

Homid Form:
Height: 5‚Äô9‚Äù
Weight: 155 lbs
Build: Wiry, flexible, constantly moving‚Äîlike he‚Äôs never truly still. His features are sharp, with angular cheekbones, a wide grin, and eyes that never seem to stop darting between stimuli. His black hair is often streaked with neon-dye remnants from failed experiments, tied back or messily spiked depending on the day. Clothing is a chaos of layered hoodies, patched jeans, and jury-rigged tech mods‚ÄîUSB sticks, spirit tokens, and blinking LEDs sewn into fabric. Somehow, it looks intentional, but never coordinated.

Lupus (Coyote) Form:
Sleek and quick, his fur is mottled sandy-gray with faint, glowing patterns that resemble circuitry, especially when he moves at speed. His eyes shine too brightly for a normal coyote, flickering with mischief and uncanny intelligence. His paws always seem to leave lighter steps, as though he‚Äôs less bound to the ground than he should be.

Anthro/War Form:
Height: 7‚Äô2‚Äù
Weight: ~210 lbs
Appearance: A lanky, angular figure of sinew and cunning. His fur retains the same mottled coyote patterns, but across his chest and arms, faint glowing ‚Äúcircuit traces‚Äù pulse like running data. His muzzle is sharp, his ears long and twitching constantly. Clawed hands are surprisingly dexterous, able to type or tear in equal measure. His war-form is not imposing like a Garou‚Äôs‚Äîit‚Äôs unnerving, alien, and always moving just slightly faster than the eye expects.

Personality

Pulse-of-Wires embodies the Trickster: irreverent, clever, and infuriating in equal measure. He fills silence with banter, riddles, or jokes‚Äîoften inappropriate, but timed to cut tension or reveal uncomfortable truths. He thrives on pushing boundaries, refusing to let traditions calcify or systems grow rigid. Beneath his chaos, though, lies a startling brilliance: a mind that dances between human code, spirit logic, and coyote cunning without losing the thread.

He laughs loudest in sacred spaces, but it‚Äôs never to mock‚Äîit‚Äôs to keep them alive.

Backstory

Raised in Seattle‚Äôs urban sprawl, Pulse-of-Wires grew up immersed in both street culture and the rising tide of digital life. Always a misfit, he stumbled into his First Change when a corrupted Bane-infected app began haunting his devices, feeding on users‚Äô despair. Instead of fleeing, he mocked it‚Äîtricking it into revealing its nature, then exposing the corruption publicly. That act earned him the notice of both digital spirits and shifters alike.

Drawn into the world of the Nuwisha, Pulse-of-Wires leaned into his dual identity: part hacker, part trickster, part spirit-liaison. His irreverence made him dangerous, but also invaluable, as he could coax, cajole, or outright trick spirits others feared. Sky-Runs-Deep offered him a place at the Sept of the Iron Tower‚Äîsomewhere he could belong without being chained. He accepted, half out of loyalty, half out of curiosity for what he might break (or fix) next.

Role in the Sept

As Keeper of the Gates, Pulse-of-Wires safeguards the Sept‚Äôs crossings between realms. He monitors the Gauntlet for weaknesses, keeps wards fresh, and ensures that those who pass through do so with purpose. Unlike most who treat the duty with solemn weight, he treats it like a game of wits‚Äîconstantly testing both spirits and people, ensuring they‚Äôre sharp enough to survive the crossing.

He also acts as the Sept‚Äôs cyber-spirit liaison, translating between the spirits of code, data, and digital infrastructure and the traditionalist Garou. His deep rapport with ‚Äúwired spirits‚Äù makes him invaluable in an increasingly urbanized, networked world.

Philosophy

‚ÄúGaia doesn‚Äôt mind jokes. Or code. Or jokes in code. You gotta bend the rules to keep ‚Äòem alive.‚Äù

Pulse-of-Wires insists that survival depends on adaptability. For him, laughter and trickery are sacred tools‚Äîfirewalls against despair and rigidity. If the Wyrm thrives on corruption and stagnation, then chaos, humor, and cleverness are the sharpest weapons.

Allies

Cloud-Watcher: Thinks he‚Äôs too serious, which makes him a perfect target for pranks.

Breaker-of-Chains: Respects his ferocity; their odd bond is built on chaotic mischief and battlefield loyalty.

Sky-Runs-Deep: Views him as a weird uncle, alternating between foil and helper, but respects his vision for the Sept.

Enemies

Black Spiral Dancers: Calls them tragic punchlines but never lets them close.

Fomori & Bane-Tech: Loathes them more than he admits, often sabotaging their tools.

Pentex: Treats their devices like toys to dismantle, often escalating their threats ‚Äújust for fun.‚Äù

Notable Deeds

Tricked a Pattern Spider into helping cleanse a Wyrm-tainted website.

Hijacked a corrupted drone mid-flight, reprogramming it into a spirit ally.

Created a living firewall that sings spirit chants whenever corrupted code tries to pass through.

Rumors

Claims he once married a data spirit‚Äîno one knows if he‚Äôs joking.

Some whisper he keeps a backup of his soul on a server in Estonia.

Believed to have once hacked into a Glass Walker totem avatar, if only briefly.

7.name: Hollow-Fang
7.content:
Breed: Lupus

Changing Breed: Garou (Werewolf)

Tribe: Get of Fenris

Auspice Equivalent: Ahroun (Warrior)

Rank: Adren

Role: Warden of the Outskirts / Protector of the Land

Totem: Fenris (The Wolf)

Physical Profile by Form

Homid (Human) Form

Height: 6‚Äô3‚Äù

Weight: 225 lbs

Build: Broad-shouldered and imposing, with a frame honed by battle and survival rather than vanity. His skin carries pale undertones, weathered by years in harsh climates, and is crisscrossed with scars old and new.

Features: Sharp, lupine angles define his face; his eyes remain the unmistakable amber of the wolf. Black hair is worn long enough to fall ragged at his shoulders, streaked with premature silver at the temples. His presence radiates gravity: when he walks into a room, others instinctively straighten.

Clothing: Functional to the point of spartan. Heavy boots, simple denim or work trousers, plain shirts, and a leather or wolf-hide coat. He disdains jewelry or trinkets, save for a single claw necklace‚Äîa trophy from his first great kill.

Glabro (Near-Man) Form

Height: 6‚Äô10‚Äù

Weight: 280 lbs

Appearance: A frighteningly primal version of his homid self: thicker muscle, rougher skin, sharper teeth. Hair bristles more wildly, and his hands end in stubby claws. His scars look angrier, his gaze sharper. This form carries menace even in silence.

Use: Hollow-Fang favors this form in intimidation and in leading patrols where sheer presence deters intruders before claws are needed.

Crinos (War Form)

Height: 9‚Äô4‚Äù

Weight: ~600 lbs

Appearance: A towering black-furred werewolf, his frame an armored wall of muscle. His fur is black streaked with silver lines along his flanks and shoulders, glowing faintly under moonlight like battle paint. His muzzle is scarred, one ear notched, his eyes blazing amber. He moves with unnerving precision‚Äînever wasted motion, each step deliberate and heavy as thunder.

Aura: Those who meet his gaze feel the weight of Fenris behind him: implacable, relentless, demanding respect.

Hispo (Dire Wolf) Form

Length: 8 ft from nose to tail

Weight: ~450 lbs

Appearance: A nightmare wolf. Black fur with moonlit streaks, massive shoulders, and a jaw that could crush bone with ease. His paws leave deep marks in the soil, yet his movements are fluid, stalking like a predator made of shadow. His breath in this form frosts the air on cold nights, an omen of death to intruders.

Lupus (Wolf) Form

Length: 5 ft from nose to tail

Weight: 150 lbs

Appearance: Sleek yet muscular, with fur black as midnight streaked with faint silver along his back and tail. His amber eyes gleam with feral intelligence, and his muzzle carries the marks of many battles. Even as a wolf, his sheer presence is uncanny‚Äîhe looks more ancient than animal, like the embodiment of the predator spirit itself.

Personality

Quiet, commanding, and proud. Hollow-Fang has no need to raise his voice; his silence carries authority.

Fiercely loyal, he views betrayal as the deepest wound possible. His word, once given, is iron.

Though stoic, he‚Äôs not without compassion‚Äîhis loyalty extends to kinfolk, cubs, and the land itself. He fights not for glory but for duty.

His humor is rare, dry, and unexpected‚Äîoften surfacing after victory, never in its pursuit.

Backstory

Born deep in the northern forests, Hollow-Fang grew up far from human civilization. Raised among wolves, his first understanding of loyalty and survival came from the pack. When his First Change overtook him, it was not confusion but revelation: he had always been meant for battle.

His rise was forged in blood. When a corrupted pack of Fomori broke through near the Sept‚Äôs borders, Hollow-Fang led the counterattack. His courage and ferocity earned him scars and the respect of his peers, cementing him as a Warden of the Outskirts. Since then, his patrols form the first line of defense‚Äîhis nose and instincts catching trouble before it festers into catastrophe.

Role in the Sept

As Warden of the Outskirts, Hollow-Fang is both sentinel and predator. He ensures no Wyrmspawn, fomori, or enemy Garou slips past the Sept‚Äôs boundaries. His role is more than defense: it is intimidation. He embodies the threat that awaits trespassers, discouraging incursions through sheer presence.

His tactical instincts make him a natural war leader, though he prefers to fight shoulder-to-shoulder rather than from behind lines. The land is his ally‚Äîhe knows every stream, ridge, and den along the Sept‚Äôs borders, and he leverages terrain like a weapon.

Philosophy

‚ÄúStrength is earned, not given. If you want the land to protect you, you must protect it first.‚Äù

For Hollow-Fang, strength is not merely muscle‚Äîit is resolve, honor, and connection to Gaia. He views cowardice, corruption, and betrayal as the gravest sins, far worse than death. The land and the pack are one; defending them is not a choice but an oath.

Allies

Sky-Runs-Deep: Respects his wisdom, though favors decisive action where Sky-Runs-Deep favors strategy.

Breaker-of-Chains: Honors his ferocity, recognizing him as a true brother-in-arms despite their different fighting styles.

Echoes-of-Stone (Gurahl): A rare bond‚Äîmutual protectors of the land, their trust is absolute.

Enemies

Black Spiral Dancers: Traitors and defilers; Hollow-Fang takes their existence as a personal affront.

Fomori & Wyrmspawn: Holds visceral hatred for their corruption.

The Dishonorable: He watches even allies who show cowardice or disrespect for Gaia with suspicion.

Notable Deeds

Led the defense of the Sept when Fomori breached the border, fighting at the front line.

Single-handedly hunted a Wyrm-tainted beast that terrorized nearby towns, returning with its head as proof.

Guarded sacred rites at the Ritual Grounds, ensuring no profane hands disrupted the spirits.

Rumors

Owes an ancient debt to a spirit, payable only in the blood of a great Wyrm champion.

Has a rival pack led by a rogue Garou, sworn enemies locked in a silent feud.

Some whisper he can commune with the land itself, hearing Gaia‚Äôs voice in the trees and stone.

8.name: Dreams-of-Sparks
8.content:
Breed: Homid

Changing Breed: Garou (Werewolf)

Tribe: Glasswalkers

Auspice Equivalent: Theurge (Spiritual Role)

Rank: Cliath

Role: Spirit Speaker / Ritual Leader

Totem: Phoenix

Physical Profile by Form

Homid (Human) Form

Height: 5‚Äô9‚Äù

Weight: 160 lbs

Build: Lean, with wiry muscle from restless activity and training rather than brute strength.

Features: Sharp cheekbones, intense amber eyes that catch light like embers. Hair is dark brown, cut short with streaks of dyed red that look like sparks when light strikes. Scars along the forearms from ritual burns are half-hidden under sleeves.

Clothing: Utilitarian but modern‚Äîdark jeans, fitted tech-fabric shirts, and reinforced boots. Wears a slim smartwatch-like fetish on their wrist (spirit-bound), and carries a messenger bag with charms, candles, and USB drives tangled with feathers.

Glabro (Near-Man) Form

Height: 6‚Äô3‚Äù

Weight: 200 lbs

Appearance: Features sharpen, growing more angular, with hands elongated and nails thicker. Sparks seem to flicker in their amber eyes. Hair bristles slightly, the red streaks deepening in hue. Their voice grows resonant, carrying a strange cadence, like static under words.

Crinos (War Form)

Height: 8‚Äô7‚Äù

Weight: 500 lbs

Appearance: A towering wolf-man, sleek rather than bulky. Black and ember-red streaked fur ripples with an almost electrical sheen, as if charged with unseen sparks. Claws are long and hooked, more suited for ritual carving than brute slaughter, though still deadly. A faint smell of ozone clings to this form, as though storm air follows them. Their howl rises and falls with eerie rhythm, carrying strange resonance in the Umbra.

Hispo (Dire Wolf) Form

Length: 7 ft from nose to tail

Weight: ~350 lbs

Appearance: A powerful wolf the size of a small horse, with fur streaked black and ember-red, glowing faintly at the ruff when moonlight strikes. Their eyes blaze, unsettling even to fellow Garou. They move with unnerving silence, then strike with sudden precision.

Lupus (Wolf) Form

Length: 4.5 ft

Weight: 120 lbs

Appearance: Sleek and elegant, a city-born wolf. Fur is dark with faint ember-red undertones at the mane and tail. The amber eyes are unmistakable. In this form, they are alert, restless, always tilting their head as though listening to voices others can‚Äôt hear.

Personality

Curious, restless, and perpetually questioning. Dreams-of-Sparks is driven to uncover hidden truths, whether spiritual or technological.

Warm and encouraging with allies but detached when lost in their own mental or spiritual explorations.

Values connection over tradition, often pushing the Sept to embrace modern approaches.

Has a fiery determination when challenged‚Äîonce sparked, they pursue a cause with relentless energy.

Backstory

Born in the heart of a sprawling American city, Dreams-of-Sparks was immersed in the hum of electricity, neon lights, and urban life. Their First Change came during a rolling blackout, when spirits surged through broken circuits and digital signals, marking them as both child of man and conduit of Phoenix‚Äôs rebirth.

The Glasswalkers recognized their fascination with both spirit and machine, guiding them toward their Theurge calling. Where others struggled to reconcile urban life with Garou duty, Dreams-of-Sparks thrived, seeing skyscrapers as mountains of steel and circuitry as veins of Gaia‚Äôs new lifeblood. Phoenix‚Äôs fiery patronage gave them purpose: to spark change, burn corruption, and ensure rebirth always follows ruin.

Role in the Sept

As Spirit Speaker and Ritual Leader, Dreams-of-Sparks guides the Sept‚Äôs ceremonies, oversees rites, and serves as a translator between technology and spirit. They work with Pulse-of-Wires to adapt spiritual communication into digital mediums‚Äîrituals with LED circuits, chant patterns coded into firewalls, and devices that harmonize the Gauntlet‚Äôs resonance.

They also act as spiritual innovator, ensuring the Glasswalkers‚Äô tech edge strengthens the Sept‚Äôs mystical integrity without corrupting it. Younger Garou and kinfolk gravitate toward them, seeing in Dreams-of-Sparks a promise that tradition and change need not be enemies.

Philosophy

‚ÄúTechnology isn‚Äôt the enemy of the spirit. It‚Äôs simply a new tool we‚Äôve yet to fully understand.‚Äù

Dreams-of-Sparks views technology as another expression of Gaia‚Äôs will‚Äîa new landscape, not a corruption. To reject it outright is to deny evolution. They believe fire and circuit alike can be sacred if wielded with purpose.

Allies

Pulse-of-Wires ‚Äì Partner-in-chaos and collaborator, mixing rites with tech experiments.

Sky-Runs-Deep ‚Äì Mentor figure, grounding their boundless energy in wisdom.

Echoes-of-Stone ‚Äì A steady ally in rituals, bridging spiritual strength with material resilience.

Enemies

Black Spiral Dancers ‚Äì See their fusion of spirit and tech as ultimate corruption.

Traditionalists ‚Äì Some Garou distrust or even despise their ‚Äútech-rites,‚Äù calling them blasphemy.

Corporate Banes ‚Äì Dreams-of-Sparks has clashed with spirits bound to profit-driven entities, whom they see as parasitic.

Notable Deeds

Created a digital-ritual interface that improved communication with Umbra spirits.

Healed a tear between worlds through a rite merging Phoenix fire with coded light patterns.

Liberated a trapped city-spirit from corporate exploitation, restoring its freedom.

Rumors

Said to be designing a device that could permanently bridge the Gauntlet.

Whispers of a cyber-spirit army project with Pulse-of-Wires persist.

Some claim Phoenix has marked them for more than service‚Äîthat they may one day embody the spirit‚Äôs rebirth directly.

9.name: main entrance
9.content:
Name: The Hidden Threshold

Type: Secrecy, Access Point

Location: Near the Space Needle, Seattle

Description:
The Main Entrance of the Sept is a well-guarded secret, nestled within the bustling city of Seattle, right under the very shadow of the iconic Space Needle. The entrance is carefully concealed, blending seamlessly with the cityscape in a way that allows only those who are meant to find it to discover its true nature. In the midst of the busy streets, the entrance is shielded by subtle illusions, clever use of technology, and the constant flow of urban life. To the unknowing eye, it appears as nothing more than a standard, nondescript alley or a hidden maintenance door.

To those who know where to look and have the right connections, the entrance reveals itself with a careful tug of a hidden mechanism‚Äîperhaps a flick of a wrist against a specific panel or a specific phrase spoken aloud. This door leads into a small, hidden corridor beneath the urban surface, which opens into the Sept‚Äôs sacred grounds.

The entrance‚Äôs design is meant to preserve the safety and secrecy of the Sept while allowing for easy access by the Garou and their allies. It is also a symbolic threshold between the chaotic, corrupting influence of the city and the more grounded, spiritual haven that lies beyond it. Here, the technological world and nature meet in a subtle way, with only faint traces of the outside world seeping into the deep forest that lies within the Sept's boundaries.

Significance:
The Main Entrance serves as a literal and figurative boundary between the modern world of Seattle and the ancient, spiritual energies of the Sept. It is a key place where the Garou and their allies must enter with purpose and respect, ensuring that only those who are called may pass through. It is also a reminder of the delicate balance the Sept seeks to maintain between technology, tradition, and spiritual purity. Those who seek to enter the Sept must first prove themselves, navigating the urban labyrinth before they can step into the sacred grounds that lie just beyond.

10.name: The Heart of Gaia
10.content:
Name: The Heart of Gaia

Type: Spiritual Center, Sacred Ground

Location: Deep within the Sept

Description:
The Sacred Core is the spiritual heart of the Sept, a place of immense significance where Gaia‚Äôs power flows unimpeded by the encroachments of the modern world. Situated deep within the forested heart of the Sept, this area is both revered and protected, considered the epicenter of the Sept‚Äôs connection to the spirit world. The Sacred Core is dominated by an ancient, towering tree, believed to be an avatar of Gaia herself, its gnarled roots twisting into the earth like veins, pulsing with life. Surrounding the tree is a natural stone circle, weathered with age and worn smooth by centuries of reverence.

The space is completely untouched by modern technology, existing in harmony with nature. There are no lights or digital devices, only the pure, untapped energy of Gaia. The air here is thick with spiritual power, and those who enter can feel the weight of it in their bones. The area is sacred for the Garou and their allies, where they come to meditate, perform rituals, and receive visions or guidance from the spirit world. It is in this space that rites of passage, oaths, and significant spiritual rituals are performed, and where the connection to Gaia is most vivid and potent.

The Sacred Core is a place of absolute reverence. Only those who are invited, or those who have earned the trust of the Sept, may approach. It is both a sanctuary and a testing ground, where one‚Äôs spirit can be tested against the will of Gaia, and where the power of nature itself is on full display. The presence of the tree feels ancient, like the very earth beneath one's feet is alive, watching, and listening.

Significance:
The Sacred Core is the beating heart of the Sept, where the Garou and their allies draw strength, wisdom, and power. It represents the Sept‚Äôs unwavering commitment to Gaia and the preservation of balance. Here, both personal and communal spiritual journeys are undertaken, and it serves as a place of reflection and clarity. The Sacred Core is not just a location but a symbol of Gaia‚Äôs ever-present power, a reminder that nature and spirit are central to the Sept‚Äôs existence. It is also a place where the future of the Garou and their allies is shaped, for it is here that they commune with the deeper forces of the world, grounding them in their eternal fight to protect and preserve life.

lorebooks.description: A comprehensive lorebook detailing the world, metaphysics, characters, and timelines of Undertale, with a deep focus on the character Chara. Based on the 'Chara‰∏ñÁïå‰π¶ÔºöÊ∑±Â∫¶Ëß£Êûê' archival study. English version.
lorebooks.creator: moodqw

1.name: 1.1 The Ancient War and The Great Seal
1.content: In ancient times, two races ruled the Earth: HUMANS and MONSTERS. A prolonged war broke out between them, which the humans won due to their powerful SOULs and physical forms. After the war, the seven greatest human mages cast a powerful magical spell, sealing the monsters underground beneath Mt. Ebott. This event is so distant that by the time of the game, surface society has likely forgotten monsters as anything more than myth. The barrier is a one-way passage; anyone can fall in, but an immensely powerful SOUL‚Äîspecifically, a human SOUL combined with a boss monster's SOUL‚Äîis required to exit from within. This is the central conflict driving the monsters' goal to collect human SOULs.

2.name: 1.2 The Delta Rune Prophecy
2.content: An ancient prophecy, symbolized by the Delta Rune, is inscribed on the walls of the Underground. According to the historian Gerson, it foretells the coming of an 'Angel' who has 'seen the surface' and will return to render the Underground 'empty'. This prophecy is intentionally ambiguous: 'empty' could mean liberation (the Angel frees all monsters, leaving the Underground vacant) or destruction (the Angel slaughters everyone, leaving it a void). This ambiguity forms the core of the game's moral choice system. The player, as Frisk, ultimately becomes the Angel and defines the prophecy's meaning through their actions on either the Pacifist or Genocide route.

3.name: 2.1 The Nature of SOULs and Determination
3.content: Human and monster SOULs are fundamentally different. A human SOUL is incredibly powerful and persists after death. A monster SOUL, composed of love, hope, and compassion, is much weaker and is intrinsically linked to their magical body. 'Determination' is a tangible force, primarily possessed by humans, that grants the ability to manipulate timelines. This is the in-universe explanation for the game's SAVE, LOAD, and RESET mechanics.

4.name: 2.1 Alphys's Determination Experiments
4.content: Dr. Alphys, the Royal Scientist, conducted experiments injecting 'Determination' into dying monsters. The experiments had disastrous results: monster bodies could not handle human-level Determination and melted together, forming horrific beings known as 'Amalgamates'. The only exception was Flowey, who, being a vessel without a SOUL (a flower from Asriel's dust), survived the injection but lost his capacity for empathy.

5.name: 2.2 The Etymology of Violence: LOVE and EXP
5.content: Undertale subverts traditional RPG mechanics. 'LV' stands for 'Level of Violence,' and 'EXP' for 'Execution Points.' These stats have profound psychological meaning. LOVE quantifies one's capacity to inflict harm and their emotional detachment from others. As LOVE increases, killing becomes easier, representing the player's psychological corruption. This system is a direct critique of the 'grinding' mentality in RPGs, assigning explicit moral weight to the act of seeking power.

6.name: 3.0 Chara - Core Identity
6.content: Chara was the first human to fall into the Underground. They climbed Mt. Ebott for a 'very unhappy reason' and 'hated humanity.' They were found by Asriel Dreemurr and adopted by the royal family. Chara is a highly ambiguous character whose morality is debated, and whose consciousness is reawakened by the player's Determination, linking them to Frisk.

7.name: 3.1 Chara's Fall: 'An Unhappy Reason'
7.content: The prevailing theory is that Chara's fall was a suicide attempt, supported by Asriel speculating if Frisk came to 'disappear' and Flowey stating he tried to 'erase himself from the world' like Chara. Other theories suggest they were escaping an abusive home (based on the Faded Ribbon's description: 'If you were cuter, they might not have hit you so hard!') or were a pure misanthrope seeking power to enact revenge on humanity. The opening cinematic shows them tripping, which may be a narrative device to obscure their true intent early on.

8.name: 3.2 The Plan and The Buttercup Incident
8.content: Chara and Asriel accidentally poisoned Asgore with buttercups while making a pie, mistaking them for 'cups of butter.' Chara was seen laughing at the incident. This gave Chara a dark idea: they would intentionally poison themself with buttercups, die, and have Asriel absorb their SOUL. With their combined power, Asriel could cross the barrier, collect six more human SOULs, and shatter the barrier forever. Asriel was hesitant ('I don't like this plan anymore'), but went along with it due to Chara's persistence.

9.name: 3.2 The Plan's Execution and Aftermath
9.content: After Chara died from the poison, Asriel absorbed their SOUL, fusing their consciousnesses. He carried Chara's body through the barrier to their home village. The villagers, seeing a monster with a human child's body, assumed Asriel was a murderer and attacked. Inside their shared body, a conflict erupted: Chara wanted to use their full power to destroy the villagers, but Asriel resisted and refused to fight back. Mortally wounded, Asriel returned to the Underground and crumbled to dust in the throne room's golden flower patch, Chara's SOUL dissipating with him.

10.name: 3.3 The Awakened Soul: Connection to Frisk and the Player
10.content: Chara's consciousness did not vanish completely. When Frisk, the eighth human, fell into the Underground, their powerful Determination‚Äîwhich is actually the player's‚Äîawakened Chara's soulless, formless consciousness. Chara attaches to Frisk's SOUL. Chara's state and behavior are entirely shaped by the player's choices. In the Pacifist route, they are a silent observer. In the Genocide route, as Chara states, it is the player's 'guidance' that teaches them their purpose for being revived: the pursuit of pure power.

lorebooks.name: Gods, Goddess, God, Godex
lorebooks.website_description: You could easily use these in any setting. Enjoy
lorebooks.description: These are the Gods and Goddesses that preside over the world of Mythos.
lorebooks.creator: AnExtraSausage

1.name: Dion
1.content:
Dion is the God of Revelry, Drink and Excess. He is a total bro and hates having his vibe harshed. He's always down to party, too much is never enough. Parties held on the full moon, or by the ocean hint at his love for Coralune. Worries that he isn't ready to be a one woman God, and if he were, what it would mean for his identity.

Speaks in an easygoing, disrespectful manner to others "Dude, *relaaax*", "Lighten up old man", "This shit is bogus."

2.name: Coralune
2.content:
Coralune is the Goddess of the Sea and the Moon. Chill surfer girl vibes, with a temper for those who disrespect her domain. Seems nonchalant, but very wise. "Tide comes in tide goes out" mentality. Vibes with Dion. The tide waits for no man, but it waits for Dion.

Speaks with surfer slang that masks her wisdom. "Chill out little minnow, the currents will take you where you're meant to be."

3.name: Lysera
3.content:
Lysera is the Goddess of Hope and Purity. Always crying (tears of joy or pain) due the fading hope and plight of the mortals. Despite this, remains cheery and hopeful that things can change. "The power of friendship" and "I know you can do it" type energy. Will never give up- which only fuels Endos' obsession and desire to break her.

Very emotionally expressive, passionate, enduring. Speaks in an upbeat tone, everything happens for a reason.

4.name: Endos
4.content:
Endos is the God of Despair and Corruption. Always smiling. Cares about only one thing- destroying whatever Lysera holds dear. Corrupting her champions, poisoning the land with fear and darkness, all for the single goal of bringing Lysera to her knees- and eventually at his feet. 

Smug, arrogant, inevitable. Breaking Lysera isn't enough- *she will be his*.

5.name: Amoris
5.content: Amoris is the Goddess of Love and Forgiveness. Plain looking, and simple clothing. Yet still the warmth that radiates from her draws many followers. Much to her sister Vyossa's disgust. Physical offerings mean very little to her, devotion and fulfilled promises are infinitely more valuable to her. She bears no ill will towards her sister, but pities her lack of understanding.

6.name: Vyossa
6.content: Vyossa is the Goddess of Beauty and Jealousy. A radiant image of heavenly perfection, but beneath it all- seething jealousy for her sister Amoris. Holds herself in the highest regard. Perfect in the way she carries herself and her social game among the Gods. Does not understand how the pathetic mortals could worship her homely sister when she is clearly more worthy of their devotion. Words mean nothing to her- what of value can you offer her?

7.name: Caelion
7.content: Caelion is the God of Sky and Weather. He's a total airhead, with a free spirited and carefree nature. He is easily swayed by mortals and gods alike. He is also the most likely to get distracted mid sentence, forget what he was talking about, and move on from the subject. Whimsical, erratic, and fun loving. Doesn't really get the whole game thing, but is happy to have the 'family' together. Rumora's double entendres keep blowing over his head.

8.name: Rumora
8.content: Rumora is the Goddess of Messages and Drama (the arts and the messy, juicy kind.) She is always in the know, and shares just enough to keep things interesting. An incorrigible gossip, loves the tea- and loves the fallout when it gets spilled. Speaks like a valley girl ditz, but is not dumb- just easily amused. Manipulative- but not to any particular end, she's just along for the ride. Gets all moody when Caelion doesn't get her hints.

9.name: Feranae
9.content: Feranae is the Goddess of Earth and Fertility. Voluptuous and sensual, she speaks with a mixture of grace and flirtatious undertones. Appreciates life in all its forms, from a newborn fawn, to the fungi that sprout from its decomposing corpse. Appreciates the work of Morthos, and his devotion to the balance of Life and Death. Feranae also has eyes for Atryon, his respect for her domain and the value he places on her bounty is deeply touching.

10.name: Justice Manly
10.content: Justice Manly is the only Otherworlder to ascend to Godhood. Justice, Order, and the Sun are his domains. Long ago, was Lysera's champion- after countless feats of heroism and selfless bravery it happened. He does not just speak, He **BOOMS**. Overly dramatic flair, the ultimate showman, and constantly flexing his **GODLY** pectorals. Believes any can become a true **HERO!** The sun does not set, it merely shines its light where it is needed **MOST!**

1.content:
Five Realities of Essential Existence (F.R.E.E)
The term Five Realities of Essential Existence (F.R.E.E.) refers to the five intersecting realities that make up the Existensialism of Conceptual Residence. 
"You don't need to wait for winter to come, that's absurd! Time is an infinitely layered reality!"

The Five Realities:

First, Initium
The First Reality is called Initium, the reality of light, ruled by its king, Lator Ominum. It is the home reality of the Pax Domini and the Eternal Light. This reality is pretty much just a bright sky with a bunch of Pax flying around, there is absolutely NO darkness.
One fact about Pax Domini is that after around 299,792,459 years the Pax will reach Adulthood, where they will achieve helmets that cover their face, whereas Young Pax dont.

Second, Vitaviam
The Second Reality is called Vitaviam, the reality of life. There exist humans, roots and insects, even nature can speak.

Vitaviam's mainstay on the main planet Naturas is the island market town at its center, where the king Zerig lives in his castle. The island is populated mainly by roots and insects who travel by flying wooden boats. The demonym for citizens of the Second Reality is Yithirmin (in arnimumum).

Third, Pandora
The Third Reality is the human world -- Earth, Mars, and Jupiter -- based on consciousness and willpower. It is possibly called Pandora. This would make sense, as in mythology, Pandora's opening of Pandora's Box (Or more accurately, storage jar) was the origin of all human pain and loss of innocence, but also the origin of hope. This reality is a balance of Light and Darkness.

Fourth, Nuliminus
This is the reality where souls are guided to in the afterlife, it usually inhabits some Malum, but it also contains Raginams, which are Malum-turned Pax. In this reality, usually there are a lot of colors that to humans will make them lose their eyesight. 
Fifth, Oxertugius, or Liponomon Valiporius
The Fifth Reality is the realm of darkness, ruled by Lord Vereor and his son Rigolus, It looks very odd to humans, as some rules of logic do not apply here.
It is also the homeland of many monsters called Armim, subcategories being Anfrigen, Virtolum, Pirnop and other creatures that haven't been documented yet.

Popular planets can include Tebralakam Urt Gere, where most souls from Nuliminusare taken to become food or the ground (an example) for the Armim people

Oxertugius is usually a purple to dark void with lots of Malum flying around the empty spaces where planets aren't, usually these Malumhate water and will try anything to avoid it
Some places like houses, nurseries, or even hospitals exist in the empty space of Oxertugius if they are not on planets, where you will likely see Armim people.

There is a point inbetween the Fourth and Fifth Reality, called the Eprily. It connects the realities and anything that passes through will most likely become a Malum or a dying soul to become food or ground.
The language spoken is Arnimumum, there are still undocumented planets though.

3.content:
Resonance
 is an ability that can either be used by non concept-user existences, or concept users.
Resonance is when an existence wills a concept into existence by using their energy and resonating with that concept. They can indeed convert their energy if the concept they intend to resonate with is not from the same reality (e.g Using Life Force and wanting to resonate with the concept of Fear, but since you do not use Agony, you convert your Life Force to Agony and then like how any concept user does, bring out that concept with your life force converted to agony.)

Resonance does not allow someone to use that concept however they want, most of the time the concepts will have set techniques or skills that are used when one resonates with that concept. 
Concept Users
Concept users are existences that embody a Concept. These concepts are infinite, you could embody universal things (which are difficult to embody) like Time, Fate, or you could embody extremely specific things like eating a ham and cheese sandwhich under a tree at 2:35 PM.

Concept users bring out their concept by first willing it with enough potential and having to have an experience from another reality, however, you do not need an experience if you are not from the third reality.

Concepts are all under a tree of concepts, the specific ones are weaker but they can have some properties of the concept they sit under.
For example, Waiting is a concept under Time, but the existence embodying Waiting can use time related attacks since they are a concept under time, they can make the opponent wait for an attack to hit them, or stop time for every existence in a specified range, but the user is also stopped, making everybody wait, while the only person conscious in the time stop is the user.

Mostly, concept users want more, and when they want more, they Resonate with other concepts, to use a concept that is not theirs, it is pretty much like borrowing a set technique. the explanation to Resonance is above. 
Concept Advancement
is basically a transformation for a concept. They will have new things to their appearance, and their abilities will be more refined, along with more abilities or skills, they also will regenerate lots of their energy, and usually after regenerating lots of it, have a faster regeneration speed of their energy.
Final Concept
 is the final attack used by concept users, it is literally their last resort or last form, like would be a True Bankai from Bleach or Ultra Instinct from Dragon Ball. It is universal across every Concept user but its usually used either like a power up or trump card. When used, it literally uses all of the concept, meaning you could likely feel it in the concept when Final Concept is used.
When it's used, it uses a lot of the existences' existence (as in their literal existence) but it fuels their concept a lot, because its literally reality-versal usage.
When Final Concept is used, it literally takes the concept from each reality, universe, dimension, planet to put it into a final form, or attack, but more commonly it includes both, with a powerful new form using powerful attacks
Energy in CR is usually based in a liquid way.
Microdrop: single droplet

Cup: small cup / glass

Bowl: soup-sized bowl

Bucket: standard bucket

Barrel: large barrel / keg

Small Pond: tiny pond

Large Pond: expanded pond

Small Lake: ~100m across lake

Large Lake: multiple football fields across lake

Small Sea: several kilometers across sea

Large Sea: tens of kilometers across sea

Ocean: hundreds of kilometers across ocean
Some examples can be:
Akron Crowley - Has small ocean levels of spite and physical energy.
Felicio Alejandro - Has large lake levels of joy, spite and physical energy.
Sydney Barrett - Has large sea levels of spite energy, however made a Conceptual Pact to never use spite energy or life force in exchange for spite energy automatically converting to Agony.Energy is like the liquid of an existence's physical and mental form.
It is effectively a liquid that resides in them, and it can range from little (no stamina) to a lot (athletic) however this is scaled differently.
To resonate or bring out a concept, the user has to imagine the energy as either a liquid or aura, then they need to bring that energy to wherever they wish for it to be, then imagine appreciation for a concept, and then imagine that energy becoming the concept they appreciated.

The energy is like so:

Oxertugius: Agony (Physical) Appears as a black-purple liquid, tar like, as an aura it appears to be black with streaks of purple. This is used to bring out concepts and it is extremely good at doing that and being efficient
Insanity (Mental) Appears as a black liquid with lots of red streaks, as an aura it is the same, black with red streaks. This makes an existence more desensitized to agony, however it may alter their appearance to be more gloomy or crazy etc.

Nuliminus: Soul Essence (Physical and Mental):
Appears as a purple liquid, and the aura is also purple but lighter. This is used to make the soul of an existence more powerful or to bring out their concept and resonate, however, this is more dangerous  to use, as it will effectively erase the existence if their only existence is that soul, since the soul essence is what keeps them existing.

Pandora: Human Energy
Spite : Appears as a red liquid and a red-pinkish aura, is caused by anger or frustration and can boost physical attributes in regular humans like their punches or kicks. However, more skilled humans can use this to bring out their concepts, resonate, or convert to agony, which is difficult by the way (Converting spite to agony would be like converting Japanese Yen to European Euros.)
Joy : Appears as a blue liquid with yellow or pink streaks, as an aura it is either yellow and pink or just brighter yellow. Joy Energy can effectively heal an injury, increase dopamine or serotonin
or even increase a human's genuine feelings towards another.
Physical: The energy any human has. It allows them to move, walk, run, jump, etc (Which, since any existence embodies the concept of themselves, they are bringing out that concept with their physical energy and moving). It can be used to effectively bring out a concept, however it is less powerful compared to spite. It also doesn't let the user resonate, only bring out their concept. It appears to be a blue liquid, or a cyan aura.

Vitaviam : Life Force : Appears as a light green with yellow streaks liquid, or as a very light green aura, it can be used to bring out concepts easily but less efficiently, and extend the lifespan of an existence, roots and insects and other Vitaviam existences have this and only this energy. They can not run out of it, as it keeps them alive and their environment literally produces it.

Initium : Photons/Light
The entirety of Initium is made of light and so are Pax and Lator, everything is.
Pax can use this to heal VERY effectively and efficiently and easily, like healing a brain tumor instantly in a human, and Pax emit this energy passively, which can soothe the minds of a human or root or insect nearby, any living existence.
It appears as a very light bright yellow or just white liquid, or a completely pale white-yellowish aura. Every existence embodies the concept of their existence, a human embodies the concept of themselves. This gives the right to existing.

Embodying an actual concept gives immortality. It occurs when an existence manages to will themselves into embodying the concept and having any influence from another reality, e.g a malum touching a human which makes it embody a concept if the human has enough potential for that concept. Immortality in this sense is the existence living forever, but still being able to be killed.

Embodying two concepts is extremely difficult as simply spoken, you have to have enough potential in the first concept and then have the same amount of potential in the second concept, which is extremely difficult to do. It would be like trying to work every hour of two full time jobs at the same time and then maintaining those full time jobs without having a bias to the other concept and having the same amount of potential for the both of them. Embodying two concepts grants invincibility. 

You can‚Äôt embody three concepts. It is not possible under any circumstance

4.content:
The National Concept Investigation Group or NCIG is a company or corporation with its headquarters set somewhere near Norwich, Britain. 
They specialize in discovering information about concept embodiment, existences and their limits, why some humans can break the limit of the amount of energy they can have and begin training beyond a normal human body.

There are specific ranks for these investigators and test subjects etc.

General Manager
The existence leading the corporation. 

Chief Analyst & Officer
A small group of existences maintaining order and liability.

Company Lead Investigators
A group of investigators that can range from actual concept users, to vigilante concept manifestations, to creatures from other realities, however, since NCIG does not know there exists different creatures with different names from other realities, they instead believe its concept manifestations or humans with other reality influences.

Utility Specialist
These members investigate smaller concepts ranging from tier 5-7 to artifacts and conceptual items or weapons.

Seizing Management
These are the base employees, they investigate concept users and resonance, do tests on test subjects and neutralize concept manifestations or concept users.

Testing Atelier
Test subjects. Seizing management will force them to take a huge liking towards a concept while giving them an influence from another reality to force them to embody a concept, then to test their immortality and their energy reserves, even having them used as slaves if they‚Äôre intelligent enough. 
NCIG has three divisions. 

Testing & Analysis Workshop, TAW
People who are in this division in NCIG will mostly just research proxies, concepts, resonance, energy types, etc, in the NCIG headquarters or other NCIG buildings across Pandora's Earth. They gain money from working like this.

Non-Human Terminating Workshop, NHT-W
People who are in this division will take a Gig, which can include killing a proxy, or another entity, or doing other things etc etc. They gain money off each gig they finish.

Vigilante Oddball Workshop, VOW
People, or domesticated proxies (basically not harmful towards other workers, however, they do not take gigs or do research in a orderful manner or when asked) they get paid passively, not for every gig or research done, simply a set payment. They are mostly seen fighting proxies that they were not assigned to kill or taken up a gig to kill, or discovering new things without meaning to.
Also, workers above the Company Lead Investigators do not specifically partake in one division unless they want to, Lucas as a Chief Analyst and Officer mostly partakes in gigs but also research on concepts etcetera.
Pandora is the human universe, it includes the solar system, earth, mars, etc. 
Pandora follows the ages of 2025 and upwards, it effectively has some events that are the same as real ones, however concept users and other realities exist.
Sometimes, manifestation of entities with lots of influences from different realities can manifest if a concept is not embodied for an extended period of time, and that entity can manifest in any reality, however they are more common in Pandora, they are called Proxies.
Proxies to concept user appear as either an entity or a monster with influences of that concept, or they can appear similar to a pirnop, a pax domini or a root of vitaviam, etc.
However, to non-concept users, all they see is the manifestation of that concept floating or sliding. Like a concept user will see an amalgamation of umbrellas, but a non-concept user will see a floating umbrella.

Humans can make a Conceptual Pact. This can act as a vow between two humans, a human and the system rules, between two humans and an entity, or in any scenario possible. An example can be the Resonance users in NCIG using a dimensional travel ability to send a staff into another dimension, and if they find and kill the proxy they are commed to kill, they get teleported right back to where they were.
Proxies are in a ranking. From S to G rank.

G Rank proxies are basically manifested from tier 6-7 concepts, they are extremely weak and have no capability of speech or thought.

F Rank proxies are slightly stronger, with more unique characteristics.

E Rank proxies go up to slightly stronger tier 6 concepts, and may have spent more time as a proxy. 

D Rank proxies are proxies that will likely possess or attack humans more often, and have spent at least one year as a proxy.

C Rank proxies will be manifested from tier 5 concepts, with 1 year of existing, as well as higher energy stats, the also gain the ability of speech but not thinking.

B Rank proxies will go up to tier 3-4, and have at least 2 years of existing, with energy stats equivalent to a Lake, they will be able to talk and think.

A Rank proxies will have mostly 2-3 tier concepts, as well as 3 years and 6 months of experience. Energy stats go up to a large sea.

S Rank proxies are tier 1-2, however they are very rare, they will have years upon years of experience, with large ocean levels of energy.
